Reviews.Title: “Typical OC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fullimit
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to this hotel for nearly 30 years for an annual business conference. Our association returns due to the sweet deal the hotel provides for rooms for the attendees and the space it offers for meetings and exhibitors. It's fortunate that the hotel does this for it is dated, kinda musty and badly showing it's age. One of the most frustrating things about the place is that it has THE SLOWEST elevators I have ever seen. On the plus side is its staff. They have some great, long tenured employees who have been working here as long as I can remember. It must be a good place to work which says something for the owner and management. In a town where there are over one hundred hotels in which to work, something keeps them here. If your looking for an average place at average prices right on the beach and far removed from the hub bub of the boardwalk, consider the Clarion.

Reviews.Title: “Conference venue wicked expensive”
Reviews.Author: sevenangels
Reviews.Content: I go to an annual conference at this hotel. While it is very very expensive even at the negotiated conference.rate, it is a pretty nice hotel. The pools are nice, conference venue good and beach fantastic. Food and drink are average in taste but super high in price. The rooms are barely above average and are dated. The staff is extremely nice and helpful so trade-offs folks, depends on what you want for your OCMD vaca.

Reviews.Title: “Would be very nice if not for the bugs”
Reviews.Author: ilikepurple069
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights Sept 6 & 7, 2012. Everything was fairly nice. When I arrived in the room there was a small part of what appeared to be a cigar under the coffee table (non-smoking room). It was cleaned up by housekeeping on their regular daily cleaning. Additionally ... only... in the morning, each morning... there were small, writing pen plunger sized, dark bugs in the bathroom... only in the bathroom (from what I could tell). They were NOT bed bugs. they ran fast, but I killed 7 the first morning and 8 the second morning. I found none late morning or after; only early morning. They seemed to come from the dropped ceiling in the bathroom and from under the commode. Keep everything zipped up when you stay here. Would be a 4 star had there been no bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the last four days at the Clarion on 101st Street in Ocean City, Md and we so thoroughly enjoyed our stay. When I booked our reservation, I requested a higher floor and NO pet room. Both of my requests were honored with no problem. We were on the 15th floor in a room with 2 double beds, a sleep sofa, fridge and microwave, table and chairs, two dressers and a bathroom. The first thing I noticed when I opened the door to the room was the smell...........it smelled CLEAN! Very clean, and very pleasant. Everything in the room was fresh and clean, the carpets weren't worn anywhere, and were vaccumed everywhere. The carpeting was dark blue, so any misses or lint would have shown immediately. There were no stains visible either. The beds were clean and crisp with four pillows (2 soft, 2 firm) on each bed, and the sofa bed was also newer and stain free. Nice neutral colored drapes covered the large windows and sliding door to the small balcony. Each room has its own air conditioner that you can set to your comfort. Ours wasn't working, so we called the desk and within 5 minutes, a repairman arrived and put a whole new unit in, so we were cool the rest of the night (it was VERY hot). Unfortunately it had stopped working again by morning, and again, there was a second new air conditioner put in within 30 minutes, and no problems after that. The bathroom was spacious and clean, and they weren't selfish with soaps or shampoos or towels at all. And every day that the maid cleaned, you could tell that she CLEANED! Not just replace the towels and make the beds. Water spots were gone each day, the toilets were scrubbed as well as the tub and sink each day. And they actually give you glass glasses instead of those wasteful plastic cups in most hotels. All in all, we were 99% happy with our choice. The only thing I wasn't thrilled with was the small balcony. The balconies are not large enough to sit outside on, only to stand one or two people at most. I would have liked to be able to sit outside at night and watch the ocean or the bay. The staff of the hotel were all polite and attentive, anxious to help any way they could. And I believe they keep the pets on one floor. We never smelled or found any evidence of dogs there unless we were coming in or going out and ran across an owner with their pet on a leash. The whole hotel was clean and well maintained. They have a wonderful covered oceanfront deck with tables to enjoy a cold drink from their tiki bar, or their inside bar, or to just sit and relax, and with two pools......perfect! We would definitely stay there again..........and again............and again. A++++++

Reviews.Title: “Still A Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Rrns828
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed at the Clarion 3 times. Most recent stay was last week of August. After checking in and walking around the hotel, my wife and I were disappointed at the overall housekeeping of common areas such as hallways, the Terrace Level, indoor pool area, Breakers Pub, elevators, etc. Our floor (12th) was very warm as it did not seem the hallway air conditioner was on or working. The place just seemed like it needed a good cleaning. I woke up early the next morning and saw a large tour group of 2 busloads of people checking out. The cleanliness seemed to improve greatly as the day went on along with rest of the week as housekeeping staff was seen cleaning elevators, vacuuming the Terrace Level, and attending to rooms in a timely manner. We again had the room with 2 beds and a pull-out sofa. The room is a bit tight for 2 adults and 2 teenage children but we do not spend much time in the room. The rooms are not fancy but our room was in decent condition, clean, and TV, coffee maker, air conditioning, refrigerator, and lights all worked. Ate a Breakers Pub one evening and had the buffet at Horizons another evening. I really enjoyed the buffet this time. The prime rib was very good. My son had the buffet breakfast at Horizons most mornings and had an ear to ear smile every time he was done. We continue to enjoy the the more quiet location (101st street) of the Clarion and beach in front of the hotel is fantastic. The fitness center at the hotel is well equipped with cardio equipment, weights, a sauna, steam room, and showers. I do think the property is nearing the time for some updating. Some renovations of rooms and common areas will probably be needed in the near future, but overall we like the Clarion and will continue to stay here on our visits to Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “"Relaxed"”
Reviews.Author: debbie t
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Clarion for a Labor Day getaway. We were there 6 weeks ago for a family vacation. Again what a fantastic time we had. A big thank you to the staff from Lenny's Grill. You are always attentive and great to talk to. Chuck the manager always cheerfull. The pet room as always was nice and clean. The buffet was great. A big thank you to Donna in reservations for helping us out. To the people who have sent a review in about his hotel. The hotel site states "standing balcony". The balcony is standing, however the desk chair will fit on the balcony. The staff at the front desk is friendly and helpful. The buffet not only has crab legs and shrimp, but oysters and clams plus other seafood dishes. There is no false advertising about the outdoor pool. The fountain in the shallow end was removed for safety purposes. Added to the pool were lifts for the handicap. Looking forward to next years trip.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie08873
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the beach but is extremely run down. The hallways are filthy and the rooms worse. I think I cleaned it better than it had been in years. I wouldn't allow my family to touch anything until I disinfected everything. Very uncomfortable beds and pillows. There was always a cleaning person in the hallway but never seemed to be cleaning. We stayed on the 10th floor. The hotel staff at the front desk were not courteous or friendly. I felt as they were doing me a favor by answering my questions. This hotel is overpriced and I would not recommend it to anyone I know. The seafood buffet was not very good. The only seafood served were crab legs and peel and eat shrimp. The decor looked is horrific with purple streamers that looked left over from a prom from the 1980's. It definiately needs updating. Our stay was from 8/25/12 to 8/29/12. This was our first trip to Ocean City MD and could be our last based on this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanview Room .... Where????”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that upon my arrival to the hotel the lobby was OKAY could probably use some updating. As my family went up to our room - I had reserved an oceanvew room - I opened the door to find out that I was overlooking the parking lot!!! I go back to the lobby and protest that I reserved an oceanview room and obviously was given the wrong room to find out from the front desk person that NONE of the rooms are oceanview only the hallways give you can oceanview room since this is one of the only hotels that is not parallel to the beach. The good thing was the room was clean with no bed bugs!!! A bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “BINGO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Koala B
Reviews.Content: After running away from a grimey motel in the lower street numbers, they Clarion took us in at a good price. My Fiance and I had a room that had 2 balconies that we could see the ocean from the mini-living room. Service was prompt when we asked for it. Workout facilities up to date and clean, saunas were excellent. I loved it. We are returning here!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: jsl31
Reviews.Content: It's an overpriced place to stay for such competition throughout the beach. The restaurants in the hotel are very very over-rated and over priced! Only convenience is that it they are so close from the beach. The hotel is not clean. Run down. Drainage system is horrible in the bathtub!!! For all the $$$ paid from the customers can't they use it upgrade certain issues!!! Pool is horrific!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay on the north end of Ocean City.”
Reviews.Author: KI57
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Ocean City I didn't know exactly what to expect, but was very happy. The hotel is right on the beach with easy beach access. Beach was clean and not overly crowded. Beach bar was great and very convenient. Pool was a bit small, but with the beach it was not a big problem. Hotel restaurant was a good value, especially for breakfast. Location on the north side of town was away from the boardwalk, but everything was a short drive away. Was a little concerned about the hotel being pet friendly since I don't particularly like dogs, but it was not a problem. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last year, but since I am just now figureing out how to post reviews I decided I should, because for this hotel it was great!. The rooms were nice and comfortable the staff was kind and understanding and the view was great. We woke up in the early morning looking out to see dolphins swimming not far off in the ocean. Amazing!!! The only flaw is the hotel is a bit of a drive from the main boardwalk/jolly rogers park area, but well worth the extra distance. I would definately stay here again and recommend it fully.

Reviews.Title: “Average, old and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Joseph H
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that is trying to be a resort and conference center. It isn't. Its small rooms and balconies, and outdated layout will not let it be anything special. It is also trying to wring every dollar out of its guests during the season. For nearly $300 per night, really, I expected more. We stayed there for three nights beginning on August 1, 2012. We had two adults and three kids in a room. The room was of average size for an average hotel. The bathroom was a handicapped bath with a roll-in shower, becuase we had been booked for a room without a fold out bed by mistake and they had to change us at the last minute. The roll-in shower allowed water to leak out onto the bathroom floor, and nothing was really provided to prevent that or to alleviate the condition by soaking up the water. The bathroom was also small. The air conditioning unit was an older model that had no thermostat. It kept the room cool but since you couldn't set a temperature, you would wake up in the middle of each night either too warm or too cold. The balconies of this hotel are the worst part of the rooms. They are extremely small triangular balconies that face north or south along the beach. They are too small to even put one chair on, so forget about relaxing out there with a dink and enjoying the view. Further, because the bottom of this hotel around the tower, forming the conference center and "resort" has grown so large, the view is basically many commercial air handlers, with associated noise. We were on the sixth floor and we were only a couple of floors above what must have been an acre of roof. the third or fourth floor would have been even worse. The pools were acceptable, but crowded, especially since the hotel rents out about half the condos in the building next door and they have access to the ammenities. The drink prices at the bar were offensive. My wife and I decided to have a round of margaritas in the whirlpool and ordered them from the bar. They were about 12 oz. each and served in plastic cups. The price, including tip was $22.00. What a horrible price gouge! We did eat at the buffet one night and, although it was expensive, and having less variety than other buffet's in town, if you want to eat a lot of good crab legs and excellent prime rib, it is probably worth the money. Well, not at the summer price -- that was still a gouge. The service throughout the hotel was very good, from the front desk to the beach rental stand. Overall, it provides what is basically wrong with Ocean City during the summer. Next time, we will revert to the drive to Myrtle Beach where most things are better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Osageo
Reviews.Content: Before I went to Clarion, I had gone to another hotel where I had got shocked of their very bad service. Clarion is one of the good hotel in Ocean city. The staff is friendly and the hotel rooms and view are very nice.... It is a beach front one....You can take your dog there . The hotel has its own parking area. It is also suitable for families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: aymami21
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Ocean city and I loved this hotel. It has a great band to listen to at the hot tub, bar, and pool. The beds are comfortable which is huge on my list of importance and the pillows are so nice, you sink into them. The staff is nice. The only two things at all that would be nice is an hour earlier check in or place to put your bags so you can go enjoy the beach when you get there, or the option to pay for a later check out to sleep in. Secondly, the view is nice even from the side of the ocean but if you could fit two chairs out there to sit it would be so nice. We learned though that if you leave the balcanoy door open you can see the beach from the sofa. The location is great because the bus is across the street and you are away from young spring breakers which is nice. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation At The Beach”
Reviews.Author: dreamcometrue214
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Clarion Resort Fontainebleau quite my accident for a spur of the moment trip to Ocean City, MD. At first I was a little disappointed that this was where we ended up as every other hotel was sold out or astronomically priced. It turned out that we really had a nice time there and glad we were away from the southend where the boardwalk is. At first when we arrived at the hotel we thought it could have been cleaner, but after experiencing being chased off the beach due to a major thunderstorm I realized that there is no way to control the amount of sand that is dragged into the hotel. The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff really nice. We were on the ninth floor and had views of both the bay and ocean, which was great, even during a thunderstorm. The balcony was tiny, but that was better than nothing. The hotel has an outdoor “tiki” bar and around 4pm each day there was a band playing music. This was really fun and if we didn’t want to stay we just went to our room and opened the door to hear the music. We also had lunch on the beach from one of their restaurants Lenny’s Beach Bar and Grille. It was probably one of the best crab cake sandwiches I have had in a long time. We had a great time in Ocean City and would definitely return to the Clarion Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th year at the Clarion!”
Reviews.Author: musicjustintime
Reviews.Content: Still our "home away from home" and still love the place! People are so friendly, and even remember you! I find that pretty special since they see THOUSANDS of people coming and going! "LILA" or "LYLA" remembers us from THREE years ago, and has the sweetest and friendliest demeanor of anyone at the Clarion, though, like I said, ALL were helpful and friendly as usual! They FINALLY got 37" flat screen tvs, too! Not that we sit and watch tv, but with two kids, it's just nice to have a tv like that for those rainy days! Still very clean, room smelled good, and we were on the PET FLOOR (we bring our family cat)! Seemed like newer curtains too. Love the beds, and the down-alternative comforters...and all the pillows! There are TWO types! One with REAL down, and the others with an alternative. Pretty cool. My ONLY "complaint" this year, I guess, would be that our phones were broken, and while they DID get them somewhat repaired in a short amount of time...they still didn't work correctly the entire stay. No big deal really! I asked if they could give us ANY sort of tiny "compensation" for that inconvenience, and they said they'd talk to the mgr....but when check-out came, there was no discount or anything to help "make up" for the phone issues. Oh well. I just felt that even a couple free DRINK vouchers would suffice, but nada! Room should have a working phone, so maybe they'll consider compensating people in however small a way, in the near future? STILL LOVE YOU CLARION, OC! We'll be back next year and hopefully longer, too! I highly recommend this place, as I did for the past four years. Hope they never go "downhill" and keep up the great work and friendly staff! Thank you! Justin

Reviews.Title: “vacation at the clarion hotel in ocean city md”
Reviews.Author: RobertaL655
Reviews.Content: fantastic service from the hotel and all its employees, great food music and the best of accomodations but next time I would like an ocean view room so i could see the ocean see you next year god willing i enjoy the beach and shopping and getting a tan so i could brag about my experience when i get back home to pennsylvania/ blondie from pennysylvania

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ron J
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel with our family. Overall we had a good experience. The accomadations were good, the hotel staff was great especially our housekeeper, Helen. The location is ok but because it was a busy week, we had to park across Coastal Highway often which is an extremely busy road. The food was good at the outdoor bar. The entertainment was good. The outdoor pool was small and crowded and so was the beach area. The beach was very wide so there was plenty of space to do activities. The work out areas were good. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Average”
Reviews.Author: Andrew F
Reviews.Content: Not very satisfied with the experience as a whole and would probably opt to stay at another hotel. We've been going to OC for many years and have stayed at other hotels before. Trying to broaden our horizons did not pay off this time. We were surprised to find no in-house movies to select from, which for our family is usually a way to wind down after a long day of activities. Parking near the hotel was limited, causing us to have to park across the street on several occasions and play "Frogger" back to the hotel. We tried a Horizons Breakfast (after all they are "famous" for it) and were completely disgusted. They had two omelet lines but only one chef cooking for everyone. The line was about 20-25 minutes long before you could get an omelet or a waffle. Usually you can make your own at other hotels. When told they should open up the second line, the Chef stated there was another Chef but he didn't know where he was.?? No manager?? We left our room at 8:00 am one day, came back at 3:00 pm and found our room had not been attended to yet. Naturally after being there to shower for 5 minutes, houskeeping knocked on our day. The evening front desk personell show no professionalism and act like they are either tired of the vacation period or have had no training in hotel management. For the mney, I think there is better value somewhere else. Water pressure was so low the shower head couldn't be used fully on any options. The beds were small and the mattresses were hard. We did like the large in-room safe. The hotel is even built facing the wrong way. It's as if they had a small piece of property to fit the hotel on and placed it sideways. The elevators took a very long time. It was nice walking out the back of the hotel to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit”
Reviews.Author: Pottsville87
Reviews.Content: Have not been to OCMD for many years but returned d/t family also vacationing in the area. Rooms were fine, quiet at night. We were on the fourteenth floor and the view was fabulous, wished the balcony would have been larger for sitting and not just standing. The dogs were not an issue at all, never heard a dog barking, and only passed them in the lobby or in the elevators. The outdoor bar area is great. Bands were all very good. Only downside was $5.00 for a can of Miller Lite. We heard there was a happy hour daily, but it was not advertised anywhere, so we never knew the exact time or specials during happy hour. Pool was crowded and warm. Not very refreshing. Location was great. The bus stop is right outside and convenient for going down town. Beach area also great, waitress service if you needed it. Would stay here again, I am a clean freak and had no complaints. Friendly staff. Loved the blonde bartender with the dry sense of humor.

Reviews.Title: “Great property at North End of Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: hugedevilsfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel had friendly workers and nice rooms that need a little updating. The rooms only have two double beds in them with a sleeper sofa. They have an indoor and outdoor pool. The indoor pool has a bar and the outdoor pool has waitress service. They had a band every afternoon playing outside so while sitting at the pool you could listen to music. Also, the property is oceanfront and they have servers that will bring you drinks while you are sitting on the beach. The restaurant is average but expensive but that is to be expected in a hotel. The kids had a great time and enjoyed our time in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place; Awful Elevators”
Reviews.Author: Rich C
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a 3 day weekend here, and are happy with our hotel choice. We loved the convenience to the beach, the food and drink service while on the beach, and the live music and bar on the deck. The room was fine. Maybe not spectacular, but nice enough. We didn't come here to spend a lot of time in the room anyway. The staff was courteous and attentive for the most part. Like many others, my major complaint with this hotel is the elevator service. It's absolutely awful, and can really be a source of frustration. Waiting 5+ minutes for an elevator only to have it arrive and be jam packed is ridiculous. We tried taking the stairs down once, only to be turned around by the "emergency exit only" signs on the door and a warning that an alarm will sound if the door is opened. Overall though, we had a good weekend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "ocean view."”
Reviews.Author: Albert H
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but there were holes in the wall. The staff was friendly. When I booked the hotel, I paid extra for "ocean view." Unfortunately at Clarion, "ocean view" means if you look out your window and crane your head you can see the ocean. When I complained, the management offered to let me check out and find another hotel; finding another hotel in Ocean City in August is not something easy to do. I asked for a refund on the portion of my room fee for the ocean view, and they refused.

Reviews.Title: “Good Save”
Reviews.Author: Angela R
Reviews.Content: I booked with a difference hotel (princess royale) back in March and found myself without accomodations. The service here was excellent and the rooms were neat and clean. They were able to accomodate me immediately as I was 3 hours away and without a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly, one of our favorites!”
Reviews.Author: KNussle
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, located on a private beach and very family friendly. There is a heated indoor and outdoor pool, outside deck with live music, and it is very clean. We love this resort and have stayed here several times. There are no ocean front rooms though and balconies are standing-balconies but all of the rooms have a side ocean view. Great for the price, very quiet! Caution - water pressure and pillows in the rooms make you wish for home.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJ373737
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City and were a little disappointed with our hotel. We booked through Priceline so we got a great price of $159 per night for a Monday - Wednesday and I am glad that we got that rate because the hotel wasn't worth much more. We checked in and got our room, the first room, because it wasn't cleaned. They checked us into a room that wasn't serviced. Instead of having room service come up and clean it while we watched, just uncomfortable for everyone, we switched rooms. Our first room although not clean had a view of the ocean and a couch and a flat screen TV. Our second room, which appeared clean, didn't have a couch,had a squat 1980's television, and a view of a roof. We did find cherry stems all over the floor, in one of the beds, and a plastic cup stuffed between the bed and the night stand. It was pretty gross. The 3 elevators were always packed with people. The indoor pool was swarming with kids. The stairs to the beach were steep and I thought a little dangerous. They definitely weren't good for the older guests. The spa and gym were surprisingly packed with equipment and clean though. The entertainment and bar staff seemed nice enough as well as the kids that ran drinks and food to the pool and beach. The hotel is conveniently located though and there was plenty of parking. Bring your own beach towels! You have to take the ones from the pool area and they are not great. The hotel needs a makeover, it appears dingy, dirty, and unkept. I won't be returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jwags99
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for a hotel to stay in Ocean City for this summer we typically turn to Choice Hotels. We found this hotel's price at $199 a night for midweek during the month of July. This a very good price. It was nonrefundable, however. Some of the other reviews I have read mention a problem with finding a spot to park but I did not find this to be a problem. They have a lot in front of the hotel as well as another lot across Coastal Highway. The check in process was very smooth. We were able to check in three hours early which is a good bonus. Every room in the hotel is on the side so you have to turn your head to see the ocean. The room had a small balcony (as advertised) that is for standing only. The room was well furnished with two double beds and a sofa with a pullout bed. The room was very well cleaned and it seemed like the carpet had been recently replaced. Our toilet was quite loud and leaked sometimes. The shower was your typical hotel shower with tub. A complaint of mine with the design of the hotel is the number of elevators at the hotel. For a 16 floor building they only have three elevators. I've stayed at other hotels before in OC and some feature four elevators plus another elevator for service only. On the terrace level (second floor) there is a restaurant and bar which i did not visit. There is a pool inside and outside with a bar located near each. The outdoor pool features poolside food delivery. My one complaint is that the back steps on the hotel that lead to the beach are old wooden steps and I on a couple occasions and I almost fell on them because of their poor design. The staff at this hotel is outstanding. Every time you went past the bellman at the door he greeted you and sometimes had a conversation with you. The housekeeping and front desk staff were also friendly. Overall, I do want to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: teresa w
Reviews.Content: I have been going to OC MD for 40 plus years and this was the best weekend ever. Beautiful resort and there was no need to ever leave. Love it here and recommend this resort to anyone that asks where to stay in Ocean City MD.

Reviews.Title: “Seventh Year and Counting.”
Reviews.Author: John I
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Clarion for the last seven years ( since discovering OC ). We wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. The rooms are functional and just what we need.They have a small refrigerator and microwave. Wish the balcony was bigger. After looking at some of the other reviews, I agree that some of the prices are a bit high but it is a very nice place to stay. The breakfast buffet is great but the weekend price is a bit much. The breakfast chef, Geoff Houck, does a very nice job. We stay one week a year and believe it or not he remembers what I like to order. This year he even started making it before I went up to place the order ( this was on our first morning there ). The staff is very nice and helpful. It's nice to be able to go to the beach then go up to the pool and have lunch from Lenny's brought to you. This was the first year I caught a little attitude from one of the staff at Lenny's. Please keep in mind that they work twelve hour days and six or seven days a week during the season. It's hard to be "up beat" all of the time. Still, the first time in seven years isn't bad. We do recommend the place and we are planning to stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “10th Wedding Anniversary/Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jwruss71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the beach (no boardwalk). From our room balcony (small - standing balcony) we had a wonderful view of the beach and marina.There is a large pool/sun deck area with life guards, bar overlooking the beach where you can also order food and there is also a full restaurant onsite (reservations are recommended). We enjoyed a great breakfest at the restaurant but could not get in for dinner since we had no reservation and there was a very long wait. The hotel is also within walking distance to various local restaurants. During our next visit to Ocean City, MD we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend at the Clarion!”
Reviews.Author: LandJR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent Friday-Sunday at the Clarion and had a wonderful time. We got a great deal on expedia which set things off right. We arrived early expecting to have to kill time before check in but our room was ready to go at 1:30 p.m. The room was clean and well appointed and the ac was turned down so it was nice and cold when we arrived. We had a great time at the beach bar on friday night (Lenny's) getting lunch served to us on the beach, and enjoying the quick room service. The front desk staff was very helpful and our stay was great, we will stay again. Drawbacks - the elevators were a little slow but nothing dramatic, on our way out we had 3 pass us before we decided to get on and go up then down or it might have taken longer. The pools were crowded with kids, but of course they would be. The vending machines were on every other floor and not accepting dollars so my husband went to 2 floors before heading to the front desk for change. As to others concerns with the dogs, we had no problems, heard no dogs and smelled no dogs. Thanks for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, most of the staff was awesome”
Reviews.Author: teddybr218
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel right on the ocean, which is always a big bonus. The staff at the front desk and the staff from housekeeping was really very wonderful. However the staff on the deck bar area, left much to be desired. The service there was bad at best. As long as you know that you will need to get up and go to the bar to get what you need you will be ok there. They also had a resturant in the hotel, that was good. The service there was ok but could have been better. The food was good, most of the time, except for the breakfast buffet on Saturday, which was all they served on that day, most of the items on it were cold. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Clarion”
Reviews.Author: Sonya O
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Clarion. It's conveniet to the beach and has many ammenities. My only gripe this time was that we stayed on the same floor with the dogs. There wasn't a problem with the noise but I have a keen sense of smell and not sure if our room carpet was cleaned well enough seeing that we probably stayed in a room previously with a dog owner. Other than that, i would recommend this hotel; but to stay on a high level floor. The pool, restaurant, side-bar, and the convenience of the beach is awesome. I will most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: casad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to get away for a romanic weekend! Stay was nice and accomodations we were very pleased with! WE will return again for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel.”
Reviews.Author: deborah b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average but over priced. Not fond of dogs staying in hotels and management explained that they have designated floors for the dogs. Whether you believe that.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful time at the Clarion”
Reviews.Author: PAMomofThree875
Reviews.Content: The trip was an overall success. I once again had a great time at the Clarion Resort Fontainbleau Hotel. My only disappointment was last year my room had a fold out couch. Fortunately this visit, two who were excpected to go, were not able to go, and we had more than enough room. I had reserved for six, which would have meant two in each bed. However, only four were able to travel this trip. I probably would have had to ask for another room if all in our party were there.

Reviews.Title: “July 4th”
Reviews.Author: godspropertee
Reviews.Content: Overall our room was as nice as we expected. We have stayed at pricier hotels at OC and this was as nice. I did not realize this hotel was pet friendly. My husband suffers severe allergies and was upset when we walked in the lobby and 2 large dogs past by. We were relieved dogs were reserved to certain floors.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip-hotel very nice and accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip! The food at The Clarion was wonderful! The bands and bars were great for kicking back and enjoying! The accommodations were clean, updated and comfortable. The pools were awesome for the kids! Only complaint was that the beaches were so crowded! But that's to be expected on the 4th of July holiday! We enjoyed the fact that everything was in the hotel. They have bars, a grill, a restaurant....everything to make it a true vacation. We didn't have to drive around unless we felt like it! We could just stay, hang out and enjoy the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “EXCITING..”
Reviews.Author: kim s
Reviews.Content: We Have Met so many friends at this resort. we keep the same dates and see them each year. This year we went on sunday and party with friends then back on wedensday for a b/d party..but to my surprise it was a engagement for me..my fiance sent up a beautiful surprise and mary (staff) help with all the beautiful music and food.When a man loves a woman played I was asked to dance and then Jim got on his knees and held the ring..a beautiful moment..beachfront,music,family and friends..awesome night.planning a wedding there..hope it all goes as well.thank you ..mary and doc and terri..hope this can work this out..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mlhipp21144
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a impressive lobby and the staff seems nice enough, but the room we had was definitely showing it's age. The shower had minimal pressure which doesn't say much for getting out shampoo or sunscreen ... Very frustrating. The blanket on one of the beds had a yellow stain ...the carpet had stains and the ,air conditioning was very loud. We were on the fourth floor and the noise from the main units on the roof we faced forced us to keep the slider closed. I cancelled my next reservation and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “An Above-Average Hotel in Ocean City on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: ennui5000
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers many ammenities that qualifies for as a resort hotel. It is a mid-scale hotel and seems to deliver at that level. The location on the beach is very convenient. The hotel also offers two pools, outdoor bar and grill, and indoor restraurants. The staff were always helpful and friendly (a rarity for the mid-Atlantic). I thought the house keeping staff also did their job well and seemed pleasant. It seemed to me that there was good management and happy staff. This translated into a good stay. As far as areas that would be "nice to haves" in improvement: I think the rooms could be updated. It is probably time for an update although I point out that everything was clean and in working order. I thought the beach grill was a bit expensive for the quanity/quality, but I do realize the convenience price. Location--not much within a 2-3 blocks north or south that would be convenient to run out. You are car dependent to access the rest of OC. Overall, I think it was a good mid-scale hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the mid-scale price and services resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: ntita1964
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my sister for her birthday so at the last minute book this hotel. The hotel staff was very nice and welcoming. Came early in Ocean City but they were able to accomadate us with 2 hours or maybe earlier. Like that the hotel has access to the beach without having to drive to. Also love the fact that it is pet friendly, which you would not know it because it is kept very clean. Would definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BrenMamadukes
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for two nights in June 2012 for a family wedding being held down at the Princess I was very pleased that our family stayed here. We asked for an early check in and was told they would try, but no promises. We arrived at 12:30 and not only were we able to check in and also upgraded to an ocean view. The room was clean and well stocked. The hotel was comfortable and clean and well staffed. There was music from 4-7 by the pool and beach, which was a nice touch. We would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A "decent" hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Susan_Hilton099
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a conference. I've been told they have the only conference rooms in the area. They did a nice job with catering and the meeting room was comfortable. They have a workout facility available, which is nice. There is a cardio room and also a weight room, accessible with your room key and open until 10PM. The location is nice - you can walk right out the back of the property onto the beach. The room was pretty clean, although dated. The air conditioning unit was pretty loud. They provide a small coffee maker and refrigerator, which is convenient, and there was a small table in the room so you could work when you needed to. There is a grocery store within a block or two, as well. They have a business center with two computers available for your use (also a plus). The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and all other staff I interacted with were very pleasant. All in all it isn't a bad hotel, but it could use some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JonesFamily009
Reviews.Content: I arranged a 3 day executive retreat at the Clarion in Ocean CIty. The staff could not have been more accommodating, which is not easy when dealing with 15 women! I have stayed here many times for pleasure but this was the first business function. Definitely will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: Everything about this stay was simply awesome...Front desk staff were friendly & helpful with our various requests. Early check in was an unexpected plus...drink service on the beach & poolside (along with the palm trees) made it seem like we were staying in the tropics! Special kudos to manager Mark & bartender Andi who made us feel special & welcome. Getting to meet & greet some of the Ravens players & coaches was a real treat. Room was comfy & clean, spa with sauna,steam room,whirlpool.....indoor pool & another outdoors along with three bars to choose from...nightly entertainment....couldn't ask for more!! Looking forward to our next trip ;-) John,Sue & 21

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Amarilisvv
Reviews.Content: Everything in one place. The adults had a great time and the little one couldn't be any happier. The staff very helpful and amicable. Memorial Day weekend and the beach was not overcrowded! This is the part we love of OC, not close to the Boardwalk but with the convenience that everything is within 5 minutes driving distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not my best stay”
Reviews.Author: WLAMaryland
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Clarion in OC many times in the past and have returned because of past pleasant experiences. This trip (during the Memorial Day weekend) however, was not my best stay at the hotel. The room refrigerator didn't work well at all, and even after we complained and was told that it was fixed, we ended having to throw out some of our food because it spoiled. What was worse was finding what looked like red stain spots on the bed linen and two "crawly visitors" in our room. Ugh! Oh..... and because the elevators were often croweded, wait time to board ran up to 10-15min.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin R
Reviews.Content: We got what we were looking for... an excellent place for rest and relaxation. Our teen-agers had a good time and our 3 year old had a ball. The outdoor bars are coveniently located between the pools and the Beach;That's all i needed. If i wanted to be closer to the action, i would try to book a hotel on the Boardwalk. Anyway, everything was within driving distance. But this hotel served it's purpose for me.

Reviews.Title: “Doubt I'd return”
Reviews.Author: BFFMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband planned this last minute trip for our family over Memorial Day (he got a deal on Expedia). I read other reviews, some good/some bad. I usually take the reviews with a grain of salt because everyone has different standards. Here are some of the pros & cons of our stay. Pros *We got a deal through Expedia *It's right on the beach *It is pet friendly *Free wifi *They have indoor & outdoor pools (which were actively monitored by the Clarion staff). *Every room is ocean view *There is a fridge & microwave in the rooms *We had 2 double beds and a pull out couch (handy with a family of 4) Cons *The hotel staff were not very friendly (front desk, restaurant, bartenders/coctail servers) *About 75% of the time there was a LONG wait for the elevators. Although it's not a large hotel, we waited for elevators because they were too full to accomodate my family of 4 (over half the times this was due to the staff riding in them in masse). *The rooms were not cleaned very well (someone else's hairs in the bathtub, filthy bathroom door, coffee pot/basket not emptied) *No one told us that we had to set up a charge account upon check in to charge bar purchases to our room. *The restaurant (seafood buffet) was mostly prefabricated, tasteless food (& only 1 free refil of non-alcoholic drinks) for $36/person. *They do not have a charge/debit card machine. They still use the imprint system. Not only is that antiquated, it made my husband & myself very uneasy (due to ease of identity theft). We realize that we were guests over Memorial Day weekend (one of the busiest weekends of the year), however, I would think the staff would be "fresh", friendly & eager to start the summer season off (regardless what time of year, customer service should be number 1). I honestly do not understand having free wifi, but not having credit/debit card machines. I thought imprinting was obsolete. The other thing I do not understand is the need for the staff to travel in a pack. Although we got a deal, we still paid approximately $250/night. For that price, we can go stay in a 4-5 star hotel elsewhere (which is what we'll do in the future). Ocean City is not worth the prices that the hotels charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CaptGreatBritain
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly and extremely helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: rmeaver
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here last weekend (4/28-4/29/2012) to enjoy our first getaway since our 6 month old daughter was born and well... it was alright. We usually stay at the hilton but decided to switch it up a bit and figured for the cost of this, it HAD to be comparable to a nicer hotel, boy was i wrong! If you are looking at this hotel and are under the age of 50, please take my advice and spend the extra $10-20.00 and go to the new holiday inn or hilton. Not only does this place need some MAJOR updating (don't think the room has been updated since the early 90's (and that's being gratious), but it could stand for some better cleaners as well. Our bathroom was FILTHY with all sorts of "spots" all over both the toilet and bathtub ans the carpet was filthy!. This hotel is definately for a MUCH older crowd (from what we saw anyway) also. OH and the room service menu is a joke (really, $11.00 for eggs, toast potatoes and meat?!?!?!) The only upside i saw in staying here is that it is only 1/2 mile from the Greene Turtle. After staying at the Turtle for a while and taking a taxi to Ocean Downs (appx. $26.00 each way) we decided to end the night at the bar where they had a cover band with no cover and we were met by hands down the RUDEST and most arrogant bartender i have EVER come across. Not only was the bartender rude but we were charged almost $18.00 for two of the weakest drinks i think i may have ever been served. He was really rude and degrading not only to my husband and myself but to someone on the phone who had called in as well. I have been coming to OCMD since i was 5 years old and have really never been more disappointed in a hotel. At least when i have stayed at dives for $50.00 a night i knew what i was getting myself into. To think i paid so much for such an outdated place and rude service to boot makes me want to kick myself. I'm hoping at least this review will save young couples from making the same mistake e did, so again, PLEASE either spend the extra $20.00 for a real upscale hotel, or save yourselves some money for the same type of room and book at somewhere with a rating of a star or two. Lastly, to the management... you are one of the few hotels i have ever seen to not offer a flat military discount (no we were not part of a group or contracted... i asked). Maybe that should have been my clue... Perhaps had we gotten a discount,the price would have been a little bit easier to stomach. Needless to say, we will definately not be staying here again and i will make it a point to tell everyone and military person/spouse i know to follow our lead

Reviews.Title: “High Praise”
Reviews.Author: MMLBoulder
Reviews.Content: My son was married on the beach behind the Clarion Resort Hotel. Myself and all the guests stayed at the Clarion. Everyone enjoyed their stay, rooms, restaurant, night club and indoor swimming pool. The staff was pleasant, helpful and always available to assist us throughtout the weekend. Thanks for making this a most memorable Wedding Day/weekend for me, my son and daughter-in-law, family and all of our guests. We will be back to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “It is okay, but remember they allow pets”
Reviews.Author: oceansunrise
Reviews.Content: We were just there for three days and must have been booked on the pets floor. The dogs barked all during the day and while they were quiet at night still made me wonder if we were in a dog room as well. I have allergies and would like to have known in advance. The hotel is okay for a 40 year old plus building that has not had any real money spent improvement wise in years. The room was adequate. As was the staff and overall presentation. I thought about all the folks that save for a summer vacation and stay here and feel like they are getting short changed, but, the attitude is something to the effect of "well, they are only here for a week then we get a new bunch". By the way if you have elderly relatives watch out for the staircase from the terrace level down to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: angeleo2
Reviews.Content: we've stayed at both the Fontainebleau suites and the Clarion hotel. It IS a resort. 2010 we stayed in the Suites with others in a 2BR condo. Really nice like apartment living with washer/dryer, fully equip kitchen and everything you need. Both places have indoor pools which is really nice for the little ones when they've had enough sun but not enough swim. Clarion has a restaurant you can access from both places. It has awesome breakfast buffet, lunch/dinner, outdoor bar and restaurant with nice ambiance! beach access is right there! We had our 1 year old the time we stayed in the Clarion hotel. Fridge was ample sized WITH a freezer. Microwave in the rooms too. We knew it was a hotel as opposed to the Condo, so its smaller, but you want for nothing. We had coolers to bring to the beach everyday, food from home. Easy walk to go back to the room for naptime etc. The beach is wonderful here. It's nice and sandy.. I've been to a few beaches in Jamaica where I would have wished to see a beachfront like the one at this place. Bring an umbrella/chair OR rent one from the guy there. YOu can pay him for the week and he'll set you up every morning. ALl you have to do is take your towel and cooler and you're set til 5pm when he comes to take the equipment back! I also love that this place is up around 101st street. Its away from all the drunken college kids but you still feel like you're in the heart of it. You can drive down to the boardwalk at night or take the bus. YOU WILL LOVE IT! You seriously could stay here without leaving the place for a few days..

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at the Clarion”
Reviews.Author: PhilipMC69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarion Resort Fontainebleau for six nights/ five days and enjoyed it. The room was clean and everything was in order on arrival, the staff members were pleasant and I slept well. I was on the ninth floor and had views of both the bay and ocean. It appears that all rooms have these same views as the hotel is oriented north/south as opposed to east/west, like most others. The balconies are tiny, however, and triangular shaped with standing room for two at best. The hotel is right on the beach, though quite a few blocks from the boardwalk and not too far from Fenwick Island, Delaware. I had a good time in OC and much of that was due in part to my pleasant stay at the Clarion Resort Fontainebleau Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Town!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandGinger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to visit Ocean City for the first time. Friends claimed to have the best time in this hotel. The hotel provided us with great services, great food, the live entertaiment is fun, including the DJ, and drinks! We had a beatiful ocean view room on the 14th floor. We had a great time visiting Ocean City and staying in this hotel. We believe no one can go wrong staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly on the 5th Floor”
Reviews.Author: Baxter21638
Reviews.Content: The "Pet Freindly" floor is the 5th floor - we had a view of the ocean - but you really had to crane your neck.The room itself was nice but dark since the light is coming from the side The resturant had excellent food and had a discount that made it worth being there during the week. The staff was very friendly.he bartender was nice however: I don't think we would stay there again - while the elevator was quick - walking down a long hallway - getting on the elevator - then walking around to the north side of the building to the pet relief area was a bit of a hassle. Also be aware that the "pet form" you sign says that while they prefer you NOT leave your pet in the room - if you do - and your pet is "yappy" they will call you back to your room to deal with it - if it persists - you will be asked to leave. Our dog is quiet so that wasn't an issue - but if you KNOW your dog is barky - I wouldn't want the concern.

Reviews.Title: “Impromptu drive turned into a little vacation”
Reviews.Author: curlyQ823
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a drive to OC for the day. We ended up staying the weekend mostly because of this hotel. SO CLEAN! The fresh paint smell (not a very heavy smell) was an indication of new renovations. Our room was on the 15th floor with a BEAUTIFUL view of the bay and the ocean. The front desk ladies were so helpful on where to shop and what was open! We took advantage of all of their amenities also. We went swimming in the heated indoor pool, which by the way has a bar along side. We worked out, we went to the jacuzzi and eucalyptus spa many times. We had to go nowhere. Everything we needed was at our finger tips. The dinner buffet was EXCELLENT! It was all you can eat seafood and prime rib...YUM! The entertainment was OK...we think they were a new band just getting started......BUT, what we thought was the most special of all were the small bottles of lotion, shampoo and conditioner...YES it seems trivial BUT for us it was wonderful because this being an impromptu vacation we hardly had anything packed and it was nice to see at least this hotel didn't try to cut corners and not have these items available and they didn't charge us extra like so many hotels are doing now....Oh and one more thing the bed was soft and soooo comfortable...just what we needed after the long drive we had. ONCE AGAIN...THANKS CLARION!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: LV2TRAVELMd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for the 100th Birthday celebration of the Girl Scouts. The room was immaculate and had plenty of room for 3 people. Beds were comfy and linens were nice. Restaurant has terrific views and great food. Staff was friendly. Pool and surrounding area very clean.

Reviews.Title: “served its purpose well for a conference I attended”
Reviews.Author: zipty22
Reviews.Content: Staff was very couteous and the resturant, bar was perfect to hang out at. The band interacted and catered to the audience which made the time there fun.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Vacation Experience”
Reviews.Author: DEBarbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in which a Valentines Day package was offered. Older but well kept high rise, beautiful views. Room was clean and comfortable, good bedding and furnishings. Once there, there is no reason to leave! Indoor and outdoor pools, gym, and an adults only jacuzzi with nearby eucalyptus and steam rooms. Covered entry and plenty of luggage carts, quick and friendly front desk, and adequate elevators. Ice machines on odd numbered floors only. There is a gift and sundries shop, and a casual sports bar. Food prices were reasonable but you could also order from the fine dining menu. The more formal restaurant is large and offers live music, billed at Top 40. The night we were there a Rod Stewart tribute artist performed. It seems that in the summer the beach side outdoor dining is popular and beverage and food service is available on the beach as well, which is unusual in Ocean City. If you want to park your car, chill out and relax and enjoy a true resort environment, I would suggest this as a hotel that would meet your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Found my Necklace!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy N
Reviews.Content: I was at a convention over the weekend, which we do every year here. The facilities are wonderful, as is the staff. This year, I left behind a very sentimental necklace. I spoke with the housekeeper, and she went up to the room and found my necklace, after pulling out the dresser. Kudos to everyone, especially Phyllis! I drove back down and have it on now. An excellent way to end an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy restaurant and good dance music”
Reviews.Author: mai2centsworth
Reviews.Content: We have a condo two doors down from the Clarion and we always go for the Friday night seafood buffet. We have been going to the Clarion for about 8 years and love the atmosphere. The staff are what you expect to find in a small southern town. They are friendly and very helpful. The buffet is sumptuous and we linger until the band starts at 9:00. This is the only place in town where you get live, calm, old school music that you can actually dance to. They have a good size dance floor and the tables are nicely spaced. The Sunday breakfast buffet is also very nice. The pool area is small but comfortable and they have an ocean-side bar and patio below. If you want to be near the boardwalk then this is not the hotel for you, but if you want a comfortable, old-school hotel on the beach, then this is the right place. Oh... there is also a strip mall and theaters across the street. I can't vouch for the rooms, but price of the food are reasonablefor a resort town, food is good, and the service is good..... what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Nights stay after company party”
Reviews.Author: somebodysdream
Reviews.Content: Husband's company party is held here each year in one of the ballrooms. This January we decided a night's stay as in order. Our check in was quickly accomplished. The room was more than adequate with a nice view of both the ocean and the bay. Bathroom was clean and stocked with the necessities. Bed was comfortable. We went to the sports bar in the afternoon for a quick drink where the bartender was friendly and quick. In the evening after the party we went up to the club where a live band was playing and sat at the bar there. The prices were a bit steep for our drinks but we were told that was because the band was playing. All in all there were no issues with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaS72188
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pet friendly!! Which is hard to find... Not to mention its a clean, friendly and decently priced hotel. I would even recommend ppl who don't hav pets to stay as well!( most of the hotel is regular rooms/ only 2 floors slow pets.)... All ocean view rooms with your own private beach(drink and food service on the beach as well. It is about 10 min away from the start of the board walk... But it's worth it if you would like to take your furry family member on vacation :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: noetto
Reviews.Content: We selected the Fontainebleau in Ocean City for the NYE holiday weekend largely because they accept pets. (Two floors of the hotel are pet friendly and their up charge for dogs is quite reasonable.) We had a great time and appreciated the ocean front location, as well as the friendly staff. The beachfront is also great here. The hotel provides an enclosed area to load and unload your car which is also great in the event of bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & good buffet”
Reviews.Author: GL726
Reviews.Content: Above average hotel, especially for Ocean City (lots of bad hotels). Dinner buffet at onsite restaurant is decent and fair price compared to lots of expensive and mediocre/bad restaurants in Ocean City. Recommend this hotel as a place to stay if you're going to Ocean City...

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Autumn_W_28
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very good service. Everyone working seemed pleasant and friendly. The room was nice and clean. I loved the balcony. The hotel is close to the beach; the staff had great recommendations on where to eat; the pool was nice; the seafood buffet was OK - we would not recommend it; the magic show was cheesy. We got a good three-day deal. Overall, we felt very welcome here and will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Sewstamp
Reviews.Content: Staff goes above and beyond to make sure your happy. However, someone in our group had a guest (critter) stay free in her room and another guest (critter) decided he'd like to learn a new hobby. Staff took care of our critter but totally grossed us out. The hotel has a seafood buffet that well sounds extremely tempting and tasty, however, hot food should be HOT and the only thing colder was the ice in my glass. I fed our waiter a cold FF, cold baby back rib, cold alfredo and cold clams. Not just once but twice up to the buffet (we were not the only ones who had cold food either) even after they said they put out hot food it wasn't. The waiters were very apologetic, I asked them to take my plate and nuke it and it was perfect. They then brought out FRESH hot fries and clams - waiters A+, cooks keeping food hot - F - totally unacceptable when you are paying $34.95 a plate. Suggestion if you go off season skip it and eat somewhere else. Breakfast buffet - sufficient but some foods were warm not hot. Lunch buffet - deli cold cuts -great, we were able to get take out containers and eat later due to the length of time breakfast buffet was served. Our group had a conference room while roomy, another party were across the hall (very noisy) but OUR door kept getting shut instead of theirs - totally rude. Staff during the other party breakdown - extremely LOUD. Our group would have been better placed near the elevators due to the amount of items necessary to complete our tasks. Trying to find security to lock up the conference room at night was nearly impossible. Great for everyone.....nice indoor pool, exercise room and outdoor pool. Really didn't care for the location of the whirlpool - only entrance was thru the exercise room and you could not go thru there with wet bathing suits. Not bad but if you like to go swim then jump in the hot tub this oprtion was not possible. The room had sizeable tv, table, loveseat/table. My bed was very comfortable, sheets were of high quality but definitely not a value for you stay. Beach access very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - could be great”
Reviews.Author: cccruisemaster
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as part of a group meeting. As a result, the room rates were quite reasonable. However when I was interested in returning during the off season and checked rates - wow - they didn't seem like a value to me - at all. That said I stayed in one of the redecorated rooms in the higher floors. It was very nicely done - nice bathroom, good water pressure in the shower, nice flat screen tv, couch, drapes et al. The only negative was the mattress - not terrible but not great either. Given the expense of redoing the rooms, not updating the piece you spend the most time on/in is just poor planning. There is a very small balcony that provided a great ocean view. I requested this when booking and they complied. The staff was very friendly, check in/out was flawless. There is a great tropical themed patio and outdoor bar between the hotel and beach, which is just a very short walk over a small dune away. I prefer the location - 5 minute drive to the inlet/boardwalk depending on traffic lights - as opposed to being in the middle of all the action (and noise.) The restaurant and pub (sports theme) were both excellent. The views are awesome and the food and service was some of the best I have had in a hotel in a long time. Prices are reasonable. They also handled the buffet banquet our group had and they did a superb job with that as well. As others have mentioned the parking lot is split with some across the street. This seems to be a common theme in Ocean City as the land on the ocean side is too valuable to use that way. However there are a very large number of handicapped designated spaces in the main lot near the entrance which should serve those with mobility issues. The step for any business from good to great is a big one. In this case the raw material is there - put in some new mattresses, add nicer sheets (i.e. create a bed you never want to get out of) and you will have a great 4 star hotel. Note - rates in OC are all over the map. Check locations carefully as "ocean side" can mean another property or two between your hotel and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Starting To Age, Prices Aren't”
Reviews.Author: jlsatud
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarion for a conference. While the conference rate was better than I could get online or with my AAA card, it was still very expensive for a mid week rate in off-season O.C. I knew it helped the organization to stay here or else I would have looked elsewhere. Due to the higher prices, I was surprised that the rooms were getting worn down. It's evident that the hotel takes a beating during the tourist season. On the positive side, the room was huge and included a table and a couch. Due to the direction of the tower, even though our room was closer to the street than beach, our small balcony had a nice view of the ocean. The bathroom was small but did have a shelf for toiletries so they wouldn't get wet from the sink. Overall, my stay was fine for the conference, but I'd look elsewhere for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wine and Cheese Basket?”
Reviews.Author: Christy R
Reviews.Content: Hello, As usual your hotel, entertainment, and general atmosphere is perfect. I love visiting your hotel throughout the year. My husband and I truly enjoy getting away from the regular routine of the daily grind to go eat, have a drink, and dance. Your place is just wonderful. I am only disappointed in the "Wine and Cheese Basket" that you offer for your guests. One of the first times I came to your hotel, years ago, I had the Wine and Cheese Basket ordered for my room. It was already in the room waiting for us, filled with a variety of crackers, and individually packaged cheese singles. It also came with two small bottles of wine and glasses. It was definately worthy of the classic Wine and Cheese Basket title. This last time I ordered the Wine and Cheese Basket and was extremely disappointed. The wine was the only thing that was good. All the crackers looked like they came out of a vending machine, peanuts too. If I had known that the basket had changed from the orginial I would never have paid for the basket. Such a high price to pay for vending machine crackers. However, I really love coming to your hotel.... really do. This will not interfere with me enjoying many, many more evenings at your Clarion. I will just never order the Wine and Cheese Basket again. Thank you for listening. Christy Ransom

Reviews.Title: “Columbus Day Weekend 2011”
Reviews.Author: Timothy S
Reviews.Content: My wife, three dogs, and I have a wonderful stay this past weekend at the Clarion in OCMD. The staff was very accommodating (even letting us check out a bit later that the policy states so that with the dogs still in the room we could eat at a restaurant that didn't open up until eleven on check out day). Ordered room service late night Sunday into Monday and it was delicious and promptly served. Looking forward to returning there next Columbus Day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for conference.....rooms need work”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Clarion at least once a year for meetings. The hotel has a pretty good conference facility (for relatively small groups) and their catering is better than most conference hotels. I don't care for the guest rooms. They have very few king rooms so I almost always end up with two doubles, which are small. The rooms are very much in need of an upgrade. Decor is dated and worn. The bathrooms have definitely seen better days. I suppose this is to be expected at the end of a summer season but renovations are in order. The staff at this hotel are always very nice and efficient. When I checked in, my AC did not work. Within 20 minutes, a technician was replacing the unit.

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendly but not the cleanest”
Reviews.Author: AP0312
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Ocean City (OC) for a work conference and decided to bring our dog. Very few hotels in OC allow dogs and since the conference was at the Clarion and it allowed dogs, we booked there. First, the positives. The staff was very, very friendly and welcoming and even applied a better advertised rate than what we originally booked for to our bill. In the back of the hotel, there was a designated "pet park" and we had views of both the ocean and the bay in a little "standing room only" balcony. The business center in the hotel was wonderful and had computers with free internet access and free printing and there was free wireless connection to the internet throughout the hotel so it made working from the hotel very easy. Now, the negatives. As to our room, I realize that certain rooms are designated "pet-friendly" so that other guests who may have allergies or not want to sleep in a room that has had a pet are not subject to those rooms. However, it seemed that by being a pet-friendly room meant being subjected to a lower standard. That being said, I've stayed in plenty of pet-friendly places and none of them have been as dirty/unclean as this one. While the "surface" of the room was fine, there was grime in all the corners, gunk (not sure what it was) stuck to the wall, the couch had stains, the curtains had stains, the bathroom tub had rust marks, the towels had hairs, and most importantly, it really, really smelled. Plus, the TV was very antiquated, the remote didn't work, and the A/C/Fan was extremely noisy, like a belt was loose. Furthermore, the pet friendly rooms are only available as double beds. Finally, the hotel doesn't enforce the no-smoking policy very well and since we had to have our balcony door open (see the comment about the smell above) the entire time we were in the room, we were constantly bombarded by the smell of smoke from smokers on their balconies. Next year we will leave the dog at home and book at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation Time!”
Reviews.Author: shellb4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night in late August with a two adjoined rooms to fit out big family. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. I was a bit disappointed that the rooms did not face the ocean but we did know that ahead of time. The beach was very nice and clean, food was delicious~we loved the happy hour specials. Drinks were very good as well! The kids loved the pool and swam in it from morning to night. The bands were pretty good that were played in the evening. Loved the location as well, w many different places to go to!! We also experienced our first earthquake while having lunch at Secrets! Would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Parking issue”
Reviews.Author: Peggy L
Reviews.Content: Parking was an issue on Saturday early evening due to customers for the lounge parking in the parking spaces at the hotel. Permits are given for hotel guests but not for guests of the lounge. Having to park across the street which was a six lane highway to have to cross on foot was very much an inconvenience to your hotel guest. Lounge customers should be the ones parking across the street as they didn't require parking permits at the hotel. If they (lounge customers) aren't required to have parking permits what was the purpose of having a parking permit in the first place for your hotel guests? The room was very clean and fresh!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rrns828
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days at the Clarion after Hurricane Irene passed with wife and 2 teenage children. Also stayed here in 2005, and at that time thought the hotel was just average. After this recent stay our opinion of the Clarion is extremely favorable. Upon check-in front desk staff was much more friendly. Housekeeping service was improved. I was asked on 2 occasions if enough towels were in our room and the room was attended to by 12:00PM each day. Common areas such as hallways, pools, fitness center and spa seemed cleaner. On a few occasions, I saw employees polishing the luggage carts. Our room was on the 15th floor and had 2 beds along with a pull-out sofa bed. Rooms are not fancy but still decently decorated and well maintained. A coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, and hair dryer are included. Next time I will ask if larger rooms or suites are available. Room is adequate size but we could have used some extra space now that my children are both teenagers. Equipment in fitness center worked and all machines seemed in good condition. A fairly large sauna and steam room is included along with showers and towels. Having the outdoor pool now is a plus. Had dinner 2 evenings in Breakers Pub and food was good and reasonably priced. Buffet breakfast in Horizons Restaurant was thoroughly enjoyed. This is the type of hotel that you can basically park your car, check-in, and not move your car until checking out. The Clarion is located by 101st street so it is not near the boardwalk, but we like the less crowded location. I live in central NJ, near beaches, but enjoy Ocean City, MD very much, and the Clarion will now be our only choice when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: Dino631
Reviews.Content: during my stay, the hotel put up hundreds of soldiers in the hotel. they seemed to be everywere I turned in fatigues, I love the army but I dont want them on vacation. The pool was small and crowded. The room was clean and nice. The service was just ok. I probably would try a diffrent place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Conference Support Staff”
Reviews.Author: Planemeister
Reviews.Content: For twenty years we helped organize a yearly conference here for a smallish non-profit group. We could not have gotten better support if we would have been their biggest client. Aside from the conference facilities which include two ballrooms and numerous nice meeting rooms the hotel rooms are updated frequently and are what you’d expect in a nice hotel. The bars and restaurant are excellent for a resort but the real secret here is the staff, most have been here for years which tells you something in the hotel industry. Perfect location, well maintained, helpful staff, you can’t ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, loved it, will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas D
Reviews.Content: My family really enjoyed the hotel property. Staff was great and the beach, pool, pool side bar added to the enjoyment. Hotel was very clean. The kids loved it. Magic presentation by John at 7;30pm was great. I think the buffet dinner was overpriced considering what was served. Breakfast was good. Only complaint was the decor put me back into the 80's, however I enjoyed it and brought back memories. Can't wait to go back to this very family oriented hotel. Thanks Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristen H
Reviews.Content: The Clarion is a descent hotel as hotels go in Ocean City,MD. My boyfriend and I were there from August 23rd to 25th. The staff was friendly. The hotel was okay, the bathroom had kind of a musty scent so did the carpet but it wasn't awful. There was a balcony that could only fit two people standing but we knew that going in. It was nice to go out on the balcony and feel for the weather and look out at the sunset. Also, on the last day we opened the ice bucket and saw empty bag of pork grinds in it which lead us to believe that they didn't clean our room that well. The perks of this place is there is a beach literally right outside the back of hotel, so no need to travel very far for some relaxation. We didn't eat at the buffet but heard good things. There are many restaurants outside of the hotel that you can eat at as well. We went to the gift shop which was small but has the basic apparel and snacks and such. I would advise that you bring your own beach chairs and umbrella so don't have to rent on the beach. Parking was not a problem to find as I have read on these reviews before. However, I noticed that they did have overflow of parking located across the highway. We went to the boardwalk twice really its like a 15 minute drive not bad at all and parking on the street by the boardwalk is a $1 an hour, so couldn't complain. The Lenny's bar and Grill located by the beach, selection of food wasn't that great, pretty generic stuff fries, burgers, onion rings, and chicken fingers..basically boardwalk food which we were tired of but if you have kids it will due especially since its right by the indoor pool. The hotel has 3 pools which is nice, 3 outdoor, and one inside. Overall hotel is good not the BEST but for a little weekend gateway it was good for us. Definitely a hotel for families they had a lot of little activities for the children. In addition, our last night we had to leave early because of Hurricane Irene which evacuated the whole hotel and all of ocean city. We didn't mind and the hotel was very HELPFUL in refunding guest's money and finding other accommodations for them. Greatly appreciated knowing the emergency of the situation and we were told pretty earlier on during the day so we could make further arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CJFBaltimore_MD
Reviews.Content: A tired, mediocre hotel. Nothing about it was above average and getting an elevator was almost impossible. Definitely not worth the price charged and we will not return. Too many other choices for hotels in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to Clarion unless you have too!”
Reviews.Author: Kth6
