Reviews.Content: I checked in at 3 pm and had to call 5 times for towels! finally I was able to get them at around 7PM! The house keeping in Clarion in not that good and for $180 dollars per night you can get some thing better in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Helen S
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and the food is very tasty. Our room was clean and featured a microwave as well as the coffeemaker, fridge w. separate freeezer compartment (first I've seen in any hotel!) and a safe. We could see the ocean and the bay from our standing-room-only balcony. Steps lead you right to the beach, where you can rent chairs and an umbrella if needed. Only negatives: I had trouble getting the foam pillows I reserved and the airconditioning does not reach the bathroom. The bathroom vent does very little, so it was not refreshing to shower and change clothes.

Reviews.Title: “No need to "leave" the premises..:)”
Reviews.Author: Kcolella
Reviews.Content: We just completed a two night stay this week and where very pleased with our stay. Having never been to Ocean City, we arrived in to town early and visited over 10-15 hotels from inlet heading north. We recognized that based upon our desire to visit hotels in person before reserving that we would run the risk of not getting in to a hotel that we where satisfied in terms of location and value. As we moved up in blocks away fom the boardwalk we felt like we may have been missing out from the downtown action, here is a rendition of our pleasant surprise- the beach - private and not overwhelmed with crowds due to location, onsite bar and grille that made me feel like I was living back in South Florida or visiting in Peurto Rico! The staff was very, very nice! From the two twins at the breakfast buffet, to the servers at bar and grille area, to the chef who made our omelet, to the hotel manager who kindly returned a refund for a few books I bought,etc... You get the picture! It is obvious this staff has customer service has a high priority! The entertainment was sensational, Ray Pittman and has band belted out songs with a serious sax player and band members with incredible musicianship. The Arizona band at night was very talented also. Clean rooms, yes the balcony is a little small. We visited the boardwalk at our 2 hour fill, and decided that we did not need to leave the Clarion premises to truly relax. Save your money front the boardwalk hotels and order the awesome buffet in the am, have rum runners our smoothies/beverages delivered to you on the beach and truly relax. Thanks Clarion for a wonderful, memorable, stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...........”
Reviews.Author: unbias168
Reviews.Content: It's not the newest hotel and was a bit pricey (that's what u get for booking last minute i guess) but the staff did an excellent job keeping the hotel, pool (kudos to Sean and Kellie) and beach clean. Food was good, the beach was great and thanks to Brian, my son now knows how to body surf. We'll definitely be back............

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Truedry
Reviews.Content: This was a top notch vacation..we only stayed the weekend but enjoyed it ..The hotel reservation system was easy, front deck check in on the money..bell stand right there to help and deliver luggage..the room was Great..clean...well laid out and the view from 1419..Amazing...We took advantage of al your facilities and Loved the breakfast..First Class...made the late night enjoyable ...Thank you..WE'LL BE BACK.. Fred Wick

Reviews.Title: “WAS OK BUT NOT THE GREATEST”
Reviews.Author: RICFOWLER
Reviews.Content: People were wonderful , room service was the best , but the room itself was terrible The sheets smelled, the room was dirty the tub had hair in it the sliding glass door was nasty, We stayed only because we had no where else to go. Will be looking for a new place to stay next year. We asked for the room to get cleaned they did and was very apologetic but even after they cleaned it it still was not good. We made the best of it.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: kenvkayez
Reviews.Content: This is a moderately priced (for OC MD) hotel that offers good value. The hotel is slightly older but in good condition and clean. Staff was very friendly (desk, housekeeping, restaurants) and on the ball. It is right on the beach and there is easy access. Indoor and outdoor pools appeared to be well-maintained. Workout room equipment was mostly good though the rooms were dreary and equipment and rooms not as clean as they could be. I think the use of the term "resort" isn't really appropriate, though there is more to the property than what you would get at some similarly priced hotels or motels - the pools, several restaurants, workout facilities including steam and sauna and live music even during the week at Lenny's from 4PM on. The terrace next to the indoor pool above Lenny's is a great place to just sit, relax, read, take in the ocean view any time of day - even if you are not ordering food or drink. As noted elsewhere the rooms are not true full oceanview but our view of both ocean and bay from the 8th floor was very nice. Try to get a higher floor if that's important to you as lower floors are closer to a roof area and will get a lot of noise from HVAC systems. Clientele was mixed, from families with young chidren, folks with dogs, some teens, some older couples and some multi-generation families on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay there again but would ask for rooms that are not on the side where the A/C units are on”
Reviews.Author: BETSY M
Reviews.Content: When we got there we tried to check in and was told the room wasn't ready but come back at 2:30. We returned at 2:30 and was told that it would be another hour or "so" I asked if we upgraded would there be a room ready and was told no.It was well after 5 before we were able to check in.

Reviews.Title: “August stay”
Reviews.Author: Jsabast
Reviews.Content: Very good. Stood for 4 days with 4 kids. Had a great time - it was away from the boardwalk - but we actually liked it that way.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BUFFET IN TOWN!”
Reviews.Author: LOVEOCMD
Reviews.Content: We have been going to OCMD for 8 years with our family. We usually stay 2 weeks while in OCMD and we visit their seafood buffet at least 3 times while on vacation! You CANNOT beat the quality of their food. Is it more expensive? YES....but, I was taught, you only get what you pay for! We are heading back down in a few weeks and after we unpack......that is our FIRST stop......The wait staff is polite and attentive. The Lady who oversees the dining room is a DOLL...she inspects every chaffer dish that comes out of that kitchen for quality! You can't find people like that anymore! Trust me, don't pass up their seafood buffet....it is to DIE for!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ranchero59
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Clarion. Front desk people were very friendly and accomodating.Both indoor and outdoor pools were very nice. The lifeguards were very nice and even helped us with a heavy stroller. Very impressed with the overall service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but kinda pricey”
Reviews.Author: craver35
Reviews.Content: For a Clarion I would say this hotel was average. The wait for the elevators was always long, staff was friendly, pools closed ealry, cleanliness was average. Overall I would stay here again but not worth the big dollars they are getting for the rooms. Very small balcony with a side view of the parking lot, and if you look sharply to the left u can see the ocean. Was nice having a microwave, and fridge as some hotels have none. We stayed in a double room with a sofa bed, so we had sleeping room for 3 people. It was nice they offered the sofa bed as not all offer that.

Reviews.Title: “All in One resort!”
Reviews.Author: jlynn3014
Reviews.Content: Wonderful friendly staff.. Beautiful clean rooms! Very small balcony.. Kind of disappointing. Must have the buffet! Voted best in OCMD! Loved the pool and private beach.. They have servers that bring you food and drinks right to the beach and pool! The live music daily made you feel like you were on a tropical island! Though I am an animal lover this property is way to nice to allow pets try not to stay on the fifth floor unless you are traveling with your four legged friend!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mag046
Reviews.Content: Its was impossible during the morning or early evening to take the elevator.... it was always crowded. There were two family reunions and this might have caused the delays trying to get on the elevator - I was on the 11th floor so going up or down the stairs was out of the question... checking out was frustrating! The room next door was a "group" of young kids blasting there music and basically having a party! The music finally stopped around 11:45pm!!! after complaining to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: arbonnegrl
Reviews.Content: After staying in Atlantic City's hotels (Caesar's & Borgata), we decided to stay in OCMD this year. Haven't been there for 15 years, so searching for a place was a chore but came upon the Clarion surfing the web. The manager booked our room who was super nice and accomadating. The rooms were spacious and the linens were super comfy! Only setback was the bathroom, where our toilet paper holder was coming out of the wall. Scraped my finger on the corner reaching for some paper! Bathrooms also need shower gel, not body soap. We are used to having a tv in the mirror in the bathrooms at Caesar's, but otherwise no problems. Pools are nice but should've built the same size outside as inside. Lifeguards need to smile a little more too! Lenny's Bar & Grill is hopping with fun. Band was great. Had a smoothie from there...delicious! Didn't get to try any of the hotel restaurants since we wanted to hit other spots. Balconies are small but we knew this going in. Very far from boardwalk, but again knew this also. Riding the bus is great in the day, but annoying at night. Drunkies literally got kicked off at night for cursing (and they were older adults!) Hotel staff was super nice and cleaning staff did a great job! Spa/fitness center has top of the line equipment. Really enjoyed the sauna..super clean and refreshing. Kid's craft activity was cancelled due to no show of instructor, but Clarion gave one free wristband to waterpark. Couldn't use it though due to time constraints plus we would've had to pay for 3 others which wasn't in the budget. Food vouchers to hotel restaraunts would've been nicer but still nice gesture! Wish we could've stayed longer and I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Per Friendly...Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: jenevieve24
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we ever brought our pet on vacation, We were expecting the worst but were VERY pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the room considering it was a pet room. The room and hotel were very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. We ordered room service and maid service and they were there in an instant. The local band playing by the ouside bar surrounded by beautiful palm trees and flowers made you feel like you were in the carribbean. The bar service on the beach was a bonus! We also enjoyed our buffet breakfast and crab leg dinner buffet. For the price we thought the hotel was well worth the stay, even though we stayed just for the weekend in July, they still honored a AAA discount. Plenty of outside sitting so you can enjoy the beach view and a drink. Small area for the kids to play on a slide and an on-site clean area to walk your dog. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place....i've been staying here for a long time”
Reviews.Author: RockT
Reviews.Content: i generally stay in the condos next door owned by the Clarion, but both the hotel and condos are clean, comfortable and very pleasant to stay in. Both are beachfront and the Clarion has a private beach where they serve drinks and food. one of my favorite things about this hotel (only the hotel) is that they allow dogs of any size to stay there. they have special rooms and, i believe, floors for pets with their owners. the staff has always been super nice and they try very hard to make your stay all that you want it to be. as for the value, i believe it's a fair deal.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: nc2dcstudent
Reviews.Content: There was urine in the bed when we arrived. Housekeeping remedied the situation, but then because my call to the front desk and housekeeping dispatch was not noted on my computer, the front desk did not seem to believe the incident happened. I was appalled at both the unsanitary conditions and my treatment by the front desk. The hotel received high ratings from others, so I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, can't wait to visit again.”
Reviews.Author: akcd2004
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, great food and live music nightly was awesome. The food was so good, we did not even visit any of the outside restaurants after we arrived. The live band was also terrific, enjoyed sitting in the tropical like patio and listening to them. The only draw back was the small outdoor pool. We wondered if the next door hotel visitors were also using it. Also, saving chairs by placing a towel on it should not be allowed. Noted towels on lounge chairs for at least over 2 hours with no one using them. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “great for drive free stays”
Reviews.Author: jadekNY
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to drive much once you arrive, this hotel offers alot onsiite, great beachfront, atmosphere, One complaint- The balconys are misleading, one can barely stand on them, there is no room for sitting there, this is misleading advertising by the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: jmg2924
Reviews.Content: For a nice hotel, we were a bit disappointed; I have gotten better service from average hotels when I go out on business trips. Our first issue was when we got into the room and started settling and making sure everything was in order when we came across dry blood spots in several areas of the comforter that we were going to sleep on or under, that’s pretty disgusting. But front desk did move us to a different room, but they did not show any concern which was questionable. second, I understand check out is at 11am and its almost expected that the elevators would be full, but when you are waiting for 10 mins and one does open and it has three hotel staff and one being a bellboy with an empty bag cart and they do not offer to help makes you wonder were their work ethics are? So over all it was not fun going down 6 flights of stairs with a child and a bunch of bags. Third it was nice having a bar at the pool, but it's even nicer when its fully staffed and you get attention fairly quickly or even at all, the bartender was doing her best so I was understanding of it but while I was waiting for 10 mins to even put my order I observed one patron starting to get upset because he was getting tired of waiting, and two a waiter had said something to the bartender and first thing out of her mouth was "what did I mess up this time" which shows the bar was not fully staff and she needed help. Typically I am not one to complain, for the most part I am easy going but I have to say I was a bit disappointed and chances are I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “We had a really good time. I wish the balcony was bigger, but otherwise the room is very spacious and clean.”
Reviews.Author: md_buckeye
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time. I wish the balcony was bigger, but otherwise the room is very spacious and clean. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet at Horizon's and will be going back there again during our August visit. Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever for Family and Cocker Spaniel”
Reviews.Author: standrewpreacr
Reviews.Content: We loved our recent July 2011 stay at the Fontainebleau Clarion! The staff was great and super friendly even to our Cocker Spaniel. The room was very satisfactory and was kept clean. Maids were always in the halls. The food in the restuarants was excellent. I was so happy to have such a wonderful hotel that I could take my family [wife and 5 year old grandson] AND dog to! We will definitely return in the summer of 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a lot to do.”
Reviews.Author: PAMomofThree875
Reviews.Content: The Clarion Fontainebleau far exceeded our expectations in terms of value for the dollar. Our hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff was attentive, and overall, we had a fantastic time. Our children enjoyed the entertainment including the magician and the face painter. We all enjoyed the hotel's proximity to the beach and the fact that the wait staff was attentive to beach-goers needs. The pools were also a treat. My children so enjoyed playing in both the indoor and outdoor pool that they didn't want to leave the property to go to other areas of Ocean City. I was impressed with the lifeguarding staff. It was a comfort to know that there were always an extra set of eyes or two on my kids while they were swimming. I look forward to returning to the Clarion Resort Fontainebleau Hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay Once Again”
Reviews.Author: cameo4u
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay once again. This has been the hotel of choice for our conventions and conferences for several years. However, finding a used bar of soap on the shelf in the shower made me wonder if the tub was cleaned before we checked into the room. In addition, the back of the bathroom door in our room could have used some Spray 409 cleaner because it was really dirty looking. The beds and linens were clean and fresh and the room temperature was easilly contolled. We slept very well and very comfortable. Horizons Restaurant food was always excellent and the food was served hot. All in all, we like the Clarion in Ocean City and do plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but paid too much.”
Reviews.Author: CAHudson
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were only going for the weekend, so we know it's hard to find a place to stay in advance for only one night. The Clarion is a nice hotel, but I feel in the end we paid too much for the quality room that we got. The room was smaller than we thought but it was decent - bed, tv, couch, etc. But several items were broken in the room - iron, ironing board, closet door, hair dryer, bathroom vent, door lock (you had to use the key card a certain way in order to get it to open). Things easily overlooked for a one night stay but an extended stay would have been different. It also would have been nice to have a book about the hotel in our room. I did like how the hotel has several restaurants on premise (even though they were a bit difficult to find). But it helped with the decision making of "where do we eat." Also, the front desk staff was very nice and pleasant. Overall it was average experience but then we should have been paying an average price too.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service. Not clean. Expensive.”
Reviews.Author: GopiRia
Reviews.Content: The service was poor. Rooms were not clean. HouseKeeping staff was not friendly and I had to call the front desk to request housekeeping. I would NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!”
Reviews.Author: Sailnjm2011
Reviews.Content: We truly did enjoy ourselves over our three day stay at the Clarion Resort Fontainebleau Hotel. From an incredibly easy check in to fun wait staff at the bars and on the beach, we soaked up the atmosphere. The staff, when encountered throughout the hotel, was pleasant and cheery, generally a reflection of management. Recommendations for other local sites were fabulous and spot on. We definitely recommend staying and are already booking another trip this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need as long as you don't want to go anywhere”
Reviews.Author: mboileau
Reviews.Content: We spent Memorial Day Weekend here based on availability, listed amenities and wanting to be right on the beach. The hotel has a great selection of amenities including indoor and outdoor pools and spas. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and clean. The hotel does show its age and wear, but that's to be expected. The food was rather good and the service was also very good. Easy access to the beach directly in front of the hotel and a really great beach bar (my hat's off to the Lenny's staff - thank you Adam, Mary, Jason and David for outstanding unflinching service!). A few observations - If you use a debit card, be forewarned that without manager approval you cannot charge items to your room. This is not explained to you at check-in, and it caused me some grief and embarrassment during my first attempted purchase. Yes, this is a pet friendly hotel but, even on the holiday weekend, all I saw was the occasional pet on a leash going up and down the elevator and out for a doggie walk (to a conveniently located doggie area next to the hotel for their business). As a dog owner, I appreciate this for future travel. I saw no evidence of dogs around any of the main public areas such as the bars, pools or spas and no signs of any smells or anything that would put off someone who's not into pets. Yes, this is a family hotel so there will be lots of small children crowded into both the indoor and outdoor pools from opening to closing with the expected level of noise, splashing and activity that goes with it. If you want to get some sun and water in a more peaceful setting, stroll down a few hundred yards to the beach. Remember that this hotel is simply not near anything other than mostly high rise condo buildings. Other than the onsite restaurants, you'll be forced to get in your car and shuttle up and down Coastal Highway to go out to eat, which isn't all that bad, but it will be necessary. They do have free parking so there was no additional expense to come and go. You're about 70 blocks north of the end of the Boardwalk so this really isn't OC as you may think if you're coming from out of the area. If you're booking online, be sure to go to the hotel's direct website (www.clarionoc.com) rather than through the www.choicehotels.com website. You'd think the rates would be the same but they're not. The hotel's direct website will list discounted promotional rates not available through ChoiceHotels that can save you about 15% per night.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jyvette
Reviews.Content: The main reason for my family wanting to stay at this hotel was because they accomodated pets. However, we did not expect the hotel to smell like a kennel. Upon exiting the elevator on our floor, the hallway smelled like urine. When we entered our room, it also had a very bad odor. We had to have our room changed because the smell was so bad. We complained several times about the smell and someone would come and do something, but then the next day the smell would return. While on the elevator, when the doors opened we overheard another guest say, "this floor stinks". I think the hotel needs to have a stronger cleaning policy especially when you accomodate pets.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: sheilamarie841
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out it was such a pleasurable experience. The staff was amazing and friendly. While waiting to check in we decided to scope the outside bar out and we meet Joe the bartender. He was fun and was informative of where to go and where not to go. It was nice considering me and my friends were newbie’s to the city of Ocean City. After check in we headed to our room, which was CLEAN and SPACIOUS for us 4 girls. Although the only downer was the size of the balcony. No space to just sit and take in the sounds and sights of the beach. Housekeeping was fast and courteous to our needs when we called. It was nice to just sit around and hang at the hotel. Food was good, it met our hunger needs. Beach and pools were clean and was pretty awesome that the staff would bring us drinks :) We loved that! Overall I highly recommend this resort to ANY groups coming to ocean city. It was family, friends and pet friendly. I will definitely be back with more friends!! Thanks for such a great experience. Keep up the fantastic work and keep hiring those friendly folks!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Will4007
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Fontainebleau Hotel April 2011. While we generally enjoyed our stay, we encountered a few problems. Chiefly: * The foam in the jacuzzi had black dirt atop it. * The heated pool, a welcome attraction during the cool spring months, was closed for repair. * My room key failed twice, once when I attempted to enter the spa and once on the 19th approximately 9:45am. * The maid forgot to bring regularly scheduled coffee pouches. While our experience was good overall, it was a little rough around the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money spend”
Reviews.Author: mdbrum
Reviews.Content: It is not a bad place to stay. It is not really an ocean view at all but you did see from room. Lots of things to do with kids or without. The room was clean when we arrived but not much after that. The tub started to back up, not enough towels or floor mat for tub. The only thing we did notice was the beds were made and trash out. For us it was missing the little details BUT was not a bad place to stay. I would stay again. Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Been coming for years; will keep coming”
Reviews.Author: ESVASpiderTerp
Reviews.Content: I live down on the Virginia Eastern Shore with my fiancee, in Belle Haven, so it's a couple of hours up to Ocean City. Even though we have the beach right outside our house, she loves the boardwalk and the atmosphere of OC, so we make the trip up and stay a couple of nights in the summer. I have only tried one other hotel once, and while it was certainly commendable, the Fontainebleau reminds me of my childhood, and an experience that I can pass on to my soon-to-be wife. She loved it every bit as much as I did. The place just has that feeling of countless summers of happiness in its aging but still welcoming walls. The desk staff is ALWAYS on the ball--never quite perfect, but way above the OC standard. You don't get the feeling you are being ripped off. The price isn't the cheapest, but the location is stellar, and we've never had a headache. I'll avoid going back to the days when this was the Sheraton Fontainebleau and I was a coming-of-age teen during Beach Week and rate it as a now-matured adult for the benefit of the TripAdvisor public, but it's hard to avoid some of those memories. Those who come here again and again understand the sheer nostalgic value of this place and their fantastic memories that they've made here. We checked in on a Tuesday evening and took advantage of the hotel's Romance Package, which is perhaps a bit kitschy, but sure produced smiles out of the girlfriend. As she grew up in the Rocky Mountains, she never had much in the way of a beach experience, and she just loved every minute of it--even the rose that was left on the bed (ordinarily, she hates them, but it's a nice touch!). It won't knock your socks off, but getting to spend some of your meal credits on room service is a nice touch. The food is typical beach fare, but fills you up. You can only take so much of the Dough Roller, after all. The beach at OC is of course crowded beyond belief, but outside the Fontainebleau around 101st St., you'll find it slightly less mobbed. SLIGHTLY. This can save a lot of headaches, though. Things are always CLEAN here, and let me tell you if you are an inexperienced OC traveler--that is something you certainly do not find everywhere. There are no shortage of unscrupulous dives in this town that make their money off the allowances and babysitting wages of Mid-Atlantic high schoolers. The Fontainebleau isn't rock bottom in price, but you'll always have an acceptable and comfortable level of cleanliness as well as service. We will be back next year and may even try one of their cabanas. Check it out--I would be willing to bet that with the hundreds of thousands (probably getting near millions) of families with screaming children who road trip here summer after scorching summer, the amount of negative reviews that OC hotels get is drastically higher than most other places. Fear not if you're thinking of the Fontainebleau--as a proud Eastern Shore native, I can recommend it in good faith.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a conference for young people”
Reviews.Author: BrendaBaltimore
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location on the beach, but the rooms are marginal. Actually, our room looked nice enough, but my bed sagged (so I was stiff most of the morning), the bathroom hadn't been cleaned well (could feel grime on the sink), the tub didn't drain (very nasty!) and the room smelled like the hotel was trying to get rid of the odor from a smoker. Staff was nice enough and the room was acceptable to the teenagers I was traveling with. The indoor pool is pretty large and it exits to the beach. For me however, a cleaner room would have made the weekend more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “It served my purpose”
Reviews.Author: SallySaysAgain
Reviews.Content: Lovely room with flat screen TV. Large comfortable king bed was a joy to sleep in. Waking to a view of the ocean only added to my pleasure. The bathroom was small but functional. The toilet and tub were in a different section of the small bathroom which allowed another person to stand at the sink with the mirror. Great use of a small bathroom space. A big plus was the free wi-fi. I have no complaints about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best for traveling with Pets...”
Reviews.Author: HappyToGetAway
Reviews.Content: Still the best place if you are traveling with pets..my puppy is my baby... i take her EVERYWHERE.... so this is important....and while alot of things could be updated--i am not staying in the dining room or the lobby...and while yes the rooms could be updated... and during busy times the elevators can be annoying... but what you get for the money is pretty good----if you like the specific amenities they offer--. I WILL NOT stay at any other hotel with my pet-the other choices are really bad! I've checked out my local travel agent who is down there all the time and also a business associate... and she agrees... while things could be updated....its the best place to be able to hit the beach right outside your door, pet friendly, 2 pools, (the indoor pool sky windows could be cleaned though!) gym, hot tub, tanning bed, food on the premises..valet parking, balconette, etc... i feel like i get what i am paying for. i think my only major complaint about the pet rooms is that they have double beds....and we are a couple that would like to be able to sleep together.... Unfortunately, with double beds, we start out laying with eachother but then end up alone on each of the doubles because they are too cramped for two people. This would be my main suggestion to the management--that just because it's pet friendly, doesnt mean it shouldnt be romantic! :) Put a few of the Pet Friendly rooms with a King Bed.... Also a bit disappointed with the basket of cheese/wine for the money. It's normally been a plastic beach pail with a scooper, a couple pieces of fruit and couple pieces of cheese.NOT as romantic as it could be for a couple like other places we had. I got it for my hubby... and I was just a bit disappointed. we always have left over crackers. Adjust the portions. All in all----I am REALLY looking forward to seeing the updates in the future that I have seen the Manager make mention of several times on here! This place has a great chance to fix what everyone is saying and bringing it up to it's full potential again....but lets give them a chance. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the off season, beautiful facility, great location”
Reviews.Author: MetroKris
Reviews.Content: It is one of the few hotels that allows pets in Ocean City. The staff was super friendly, and it was a great location

Reviews.Title: “Great for pets”
Reviews.Author: Carol607
Reviews.Content: This is the best place in Ocean city if you have a dog. It is very pet friendly. Service is great but the rooms are a little dated.

Reviews.Title: “Noticeable decline in service”
Reviews.Author: vld45
Reviews.Content: As a returning guest of the past several years, We have to say we were a bit disappointed in our stay this time. We noted several small, but still notable, changes in service since our last viist. Although our room was cleaned everyday the soaps, shampoos, and shower caps were NEVER replenished during our 4 night stay. Upon waking on our first morning we found that we didn't have caffeinated coffee and I had to go out to the service personnel in the hall and ask for it. The food was still fantastic, but when we ordered our longtime favorite items the prortions were not as generous as in the past. The hallways were not as clean as in past stays. We still love the Clarion OC, but have to say that for the cost per night we may have to reconsider other accomodations in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a lot to offer”
Reviews.Author: March12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! Had a few problems but they were corrected,suffered some because of it and lost time from my vacation activites but overall it worked!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great restaurant, and pet-friendly!”
Reviews.Author: musicjustintime
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd year in a row staying here. Love the fact that each room has an ocean view, and little balcony to watch the sunrise from. Also, has its own private beach, just a few yards from the hotel! Pet-friendly, and we always take our kitty along with us. Has TWO pools, one outside and one inside...your choice. Horizons restaurant is DELICIOUS! Best breakfast buffet, dinners, and seafood buffet around, I think! AND, the staff is very friendly and helpful. Oh, and their prime rib is KILLER good! So nice, you can cut it with a fork! Outdoor bar, for when you're hangin' by the pool...indoor "sports bar" (it's a "raw bar" too), gift shop, and jewelry store too! Neat that you don't have to really leave the hotel if you don't want to...for rainy days, or just lazy days! Pizza places are great in the area (and everywhere!) and most restaurants nearby deliver or at the very least, have take-out. We love the Clarion O.C. and Ocean City in general. Sad to be back in PA, but nice to know it's waiting for us when we return! Rooms are spacious, with fridge and microwave...but this year, we had problems with our microwave not heating up...and the "new" one they gave us didn't do much better! BUT, we survived! So what if it took 15 minutes to heat up 1 slice of pizza! We were on vacation and not in a hurry! HA! If you have a little one and/or a pet...I HIGHLY recommend the Clarion Resort Fontainebleau Hotel. Oh yeah, the rooms are always so quiet...so must be that they're really well insulated or something! Always so quiet at night, and one of the few hotels I can actually SLEEP in! Hope this helps. Don't expect a "Trump" hotel here, but DO expect a decent price, convienience, and really...you're not in your room long enough to dislike it when in Ocean City, MD! Happy vacationing friends! Justin

Reviews.Title: “good for the price to many dogs”
Reviews.Author: ja3793
Reviews.Content: First time staying here been coming to OC for 12 yrs I booked online and the price was right we asked for a upper level and the north side of building, wasn't a problem flr 15. great! The room was dated and had alot of wear , the carpet looked clean didn't have to wear shoes in room the sheets and pillows were clean also, room was for the most part clean except for the large mark next to bed that was never cleaned rt 1505. housekeeping came to clean room at about 9am little early for me but we should have let them room wasnt cleaned till after 4 pm after calling 2 times. the bar areas were nice and well kept the bands were good gave a real vacation atmosphere for OC outdoor pool was ok little small the indoor pool area was filthy the glass atrium looked like it gets cleaned maybe once a year may stay again TO many dogs everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Coffee”
Reviews.Author: meandwife65
Reviews.Content: As a repeat guest, again enjoyed our week at the beach. BUT you really need to have coffee in the lobby or Terrace (on a cart outside Horizon DR?) for the early risers like me. Coffee in the room only means waking up wife as early as me. Not Good!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in a Clarion Resort”
Reviews.Author: jimae1016
Reviews.Content: My family had an unexpected trip to Ocean City Maryland. We stop into thish otel with the hopes of finding a room at the last minute. We choose this hotel because we hear many good things about the Clarion Brand. The room we stayed in had mold on the ceiling and Dog poop stains on the carpet. We didn't know the hotel allowed pets. We first figured that out because of the smell in the hall way. We called around to other hotels but could not find any open rooms. We were stuck. We had no choice but to stay in this dirty room. At check out I told the CS rep who checked us out. She wrote on a scrap piece of paper mold on ceiling, gross stains on carpet. That left my family with the impression that our complaint was only good enough for a scrap piece of paper. We were very diappointment. We will never stay at a clarion. We plan on telling friends and family about our experience. We only stayed one night and moved onto the Dunes Manor Hotel. Which was great. Don't remember the room number, Tried to forget as much about this hotel as possible, We were on the third floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach0409
Reviews.Content: The hotel was getting old but still decent. Beds were comfortable. The staff was always pleasant. The balcony's are small and triangular. They aren't made for sitting, but you can drag one chair out there and sit. The balconies are on the side of the building, but you can still see the ocean. Would I stay there again, not sure. Not being able to sit on the balcony in the early morning or the evening was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “world class service”
Reviews.Author: elrae
Reviews.Content: Just finishing up my annual business stay here, and I will say it again, this is one of the best managed hotels I have ever stayed in. For me, the excellence of the staff makes my stay. From top to bottom, the people who work here are fantastic. From the young waiter on the beach deck who ran up a floor and into the restaurant to rig me up iced coffee (not on the menu) to everyone I ran into in the elevator who said "have a nice day," and it didn't sound fake, to the great bellman who is so lovely to deal with every year, they are amazing. The girl at the front desk who directed me to a quiet table to work on my laptop, and gave me fresh towels to wipe off the seats, the young man who saw me sitting there working and came over with a free cold soda and a glass of ice, and all the staff who treat my elderly mother with such kindness - they'd see her sitting and bring her an on-the-house lemonade. Thank you all again. You may find fancier, newer furnishings and bigger decks with better views in other hotels in O.C., but no place down here even comes close to the quality of service. That is what brings me back every year.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: WorldsTreasures
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! As a first timer to Ocean City, I will definitely come back and this is my choice hotel, without a doubt. Fantastic food, clean rooms...beach and entertainment areas. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. The breakfast and seafood buffet is reasonable and worth the treat. Everything you need in a vacation is right at the hotel or within travel distance for sightseeing and other experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Elevators a bit slow, but very nice place to stay and relax with family”
Reviews.Author: Greenie50
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Good beach. Kids loved the pool. If you're in a hurry to ride the elevators up or down, not the place for you. Restaurant is decent. The all-you-can-eat crabs are definitely filling.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sde_03
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here for years - first with my family as a child and now as an adult with my fiance. Can't beat the location - you literally walk out of your hotel and onto the beach. Staff is attentive and helpful, rooms are clean and comfortable. Food's fantastic - we visited the all you can eat buffet - it's improved drastically from what I last remember. Lots of fresh seafood. Can't wait to return next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovations”
Reviews.Author: SemperFive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location, but it is in desparate need of repair and updating. The decor throughout the hotel is hideous; the carpets are wet and smelly, and the walls need a fresh coat of paint. Benefits from a beachside bar and restaurant but the outdoor pool is overcrowded to the max. The water was literally green due to the abundance of urine.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice time”
Reviews.Author: bkdp01
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything you could need without having to go outside. A little pricey for the middle American family though. Service was good and comes with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: linisalazar
Reviews.Content: I am used to travel and stay in hotels but this one was a really bad experience. The hotel offers ocean view when the view is not really direct to the ocean but rather to another hotel in front. If you are lucky you'll get a room in the corner where you could see the ocean better. The balcony is tiny!!! You can't even sit there!. The room is dirty. In fact, the comforter was dirty and had to call 5 times to try to get it changed!!! The person in the front desk made me feel as if they were doing a favour to me for changing the dirty comforter...I was very dissapointed with this situation. The room was also dirty. There was a gum sticked in the wall next to the refrigerator, it was really disgusting. The furniture is outdated and so is the tv. Honestly, I would never recommend this hotel (and discourage people who will ask me about it) because the price is too high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good pools, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Zak77
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Fountainebleau for 3 years and we've watched it slowly go downhill. This year our room was not clean. We unfolded the sleeper sofa and the sheets were quite dirty with dead bugs etc in them. We called housekeeping and it seemed as though we were bothing them and they just dropped off the sheets and did not put them on for us. The worst part was the hallway on our floor. It smelled like a litterbox and the floor was COVERED in trash. We called numerous times to have the hallway cleaned and no one ever did. The outdoor pool is perfect for our kids and the great location to the beach is fantastic. The outdoor grill makes very good food, a little overpriced though. We are not sure if we'd go back for our 4th year in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Total pit of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: 33388Laura
Reviews.Content: First visit / stay in Ocean City, I should have researched comments and reviews further rather then just using the hotel website which is so misleading it should be a crime. This hotel is so run down and dirty at midnight I was trying ton find other accomdations. We frequently travel with our small dog and stay at dog friendly hotels but I have never experienced such terrible ammonia orders or hotels that allow guest to lock their dogs in a room all day unattended, upon arriving to our room another dog was urinating in the hallway. The hotel is completely over priced for the quality of service and accomdations.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lexon1212
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, always clean, and staff was very helpful. One of the things that was important to our stay was the health spa that was open to guests of the hotel after checking out. Because we were able to shower and change in the spa before leaving for home, we were able to check out of the hotel at regular check out time, and could still spend the day at the beach instead of heading home early. The restaurant had an excellent breakfast buffet daily at a fantastic price. The food was cooked to order, and the staff was always checking on our table to see if we needed anything else. The buffet was very affordable for families. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: sjvgri
Reviews.Content: do not stay in this hotel - old, dirty, molded, and not accomadating at all! the only up is the beach, never been to oc maryland, read great reviews but this has been the worse hotel i ever stood at !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beach Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MarciaWitt
Reviews.Content: I was so relieved and had a very wonderful time from July 11 - July 17, 2010! Prior to my arrival, I made the mistake of reading hotel reviews -- and the reviews were actually almost scaring me. Prior to my recent stay, I never read hotel reviews and never wrote one. However, I felt moved to write this one, due to the negative press I previously had been reading regarding the Clarion. I found the room very neat & clean -- I was most pleased with the linens on the bed (so nice, luxurious & soft)! Since I had a pet with me and was meet friends on another part of the beach most days, I missed room cleaning time. However, early in the morning, I took it upon myself to call Housekeeping (not the front desk) -- I made arrangements with a time when they could come in to clean (and I would be with the dog) and/or I exchanged dirty towels for clean towels. The 2-3 times I did so, I found them to be most courteous, timely, efficient & thorough. Another time, my toilet was running, but was unable to fix the problem myself. I called the front desk who called maintenance. I asked them for an estimate of time for arrival & was stunned when they arrived within 5 minutes -- no more than another 5 minutes before the problem was fixed. Another time, my room key wouldn't work -- within 5 minutes, that was a non-issue. Periodically, I had questions and I was always met with friendliness and courtesy -- very professional staff. I stayed on a pet floor (brought my 11 year old lab mix). I was on the pet floor (5th floor) -- my only wish was that I had a room that had a closer view to the ocean. However, that's no problem -- I'll know what to ask for the next time. Only other negatives lie with other pet owners -- pet owners (and I am one) need to be responsible!!! If your pet has separation anxiety issues, be courteous of other hotel guests I was very happy to be travelling with my dog. Any issues that I might have had during my stay really pertain and should be directed to other dog owners. Advice to those who might be travelling with pets. The hotel offers a wonderful perk -- ability to bring your pet. Please do not ruin a good thing by being irresponsible. You know it's the law -- pick up after your pet. The sandlot there for you & your pet --- they supply bags, a trash dispenser AND a pooper-scooper. There is not one excuse for not picking up after your pet. I was stunned that people were not picking up after their pet and this was difficult especially in the evening. I got around the issue by taking my dog for longer walks (across the street (bayside of Coastal Highway). In addition, I used the fan a lot to drown out the whines and/or barking from other dogs. If you know your dog has separation anxiety issues, you might not want to stay out all night -- be courteous of the other hotel guests and their pets -- this is their vacation too! All in all, I (WE -- my dog & I) had a WONDERFUL time! Very courteous staff and very clean hotel -- we will glady come & stay at the Clarion again!!! :-) (Next time, I know that I will check for specials -- I stayed for $250 per night -- no inclusion of meals, spa time, etc. -- however, I think that's something I myself should have done a better job of looking into before having booked my stay. I should have looked for available specials.)

Reviews.Title: “A restful, pleasant stay at the Clarion”
Reviews.Author: ihatedopes
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the room and the Clarion in general. Two pools, two restaurants and an outdoor tiki bar/grill with live entertainment; great views of both the ocean and the bay; private access to the beach; all for an affordable price! The beds were comfortable and what else can I say? I will stay at the Clarion again and give it the thumbs up to people who ask me about it. I was surprised to see the negative reviews on this site, but some people are hard or impossible to please. It's true the balcony is small but I enjoyed sitting on the couch with the sliding doors open and looking out at the ocean that way. I had a truly lovely stay in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christon68
Reviews.Content: The staff at the desk was quite rude. Our room key did not work correctly, even after being reprogramed several times. There are only three elevators and no service elevator, so not only does it take a long time to get an elevator, then half the time your sharing it with a laundry cart or dirty dishes. We were not informed that a hold would be put on our account for 30% more than our charges for "inncedentals" tying up money we could have used on our vacation. Housekeeping knocked on the door way too early each day, and then if we told them to come back in a little while, they would not come back until late in the afternoon. The basket of condiments for the coffee was not replenished, and when my husband went to get cream and sugar and the desk he was treated very poorly. I have never stayed in a more poorly operated hotel, we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bellaboo66
Reviews.Content: Our first visit at the Clarion was on Easter 2 years ago. We brought our dog. We werent sure what to expect. But when we checked in, WOW! What a nice place! The room was clean with a beautiful view. The beds were soooo comfortable with nice pillows. The Easter Buffet was out of this world. The view from the restaurant was beautiful. Because it was off season we were allowed to bring our dog "Bella" to the beach. (although she wasnt to sure of the ocean). Our daughter loved the indoor pool. Our overnight stay was so nice, we went again this past Easter. This summer, we checked in on Tues. July 13th, and checked out on Friday July 16th. although we didnt have our dog on this trip. We stayed on the 14th floor. Again, our stay was absolutly, wonderful. This time our daughter swam in both the outdoor and indoor pool. The pool side bar was great with the band. This hotel is a great place to stay anytime of the year. Its alot better then the hotels on the boardwalk. And you get more for your money. If we can, we would like to come back one last time before our daughter starts school and this time bring our dog Bella back. Otherwise, we will be back next year at Easter and again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: rzolt
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City. We planned this trip for many months and looked forward to trying something new (new place, new hotel). Unfortunately, staying at this hotel was a big mistake. The furniture was old and needed refreshing and it's the first hotel I've stayed in in 5 years that didn't have flat-panel HDTV's. But, this is not the real problem of the place. Our biggest problem was that the hotel allows non-guests to sit at the pool and use all the facilities at the hotel. Throughout our stay the pool, which is very small, was crowded and many people were not guests at the hotel. In addition, a few people put up tent-like structures on the beach with coolers and every other amenity you could think of. OK, I guess they have a right even if they're not staying at the hotelt, but what bothered us is when this one guy was telling someone else that the hotel allows non-guests to use all the facilities (parking lot, pool, beach, bathrooms, pool towels). I hate to sound like a spoilsport, but what am I paying for if anyone can drive up, park in the lot, and use the pool and beach without being an overnight guest? I sent an e-mail to Choice Hotels and the hotel's general manager sent me an e-mail explaining the hotel policy which allows anyone to use the restaurant, bars, and other facilities on the premises. He offered to help us plan our next trip there and would see that we got a good room rate, but why on earth would we ever stay there again?!?. Although the staff is friendly the rooms aren't nice enough and we didn't go there to be packed like sardines while sharing the facilities with non-overnight guests. That so many people come onto the premises from the parking lot made us feel less safe as there didn't seem to be any deterent if people came with the wrong intensions. I also don't know what prevented strangers from accessing the rooms if they just got on an elevator and got off wherever they wanted. I responded to the general manager that we would never stay there again and repeated that when I called Choice Hotels today to follow up. While the hotel must do remarkably well because of the free access to the premises it really doesn't work as well for people who do not appreciate the "open party" atmosphere. Regardless of how management responds to my review I find their policies unacceptable and don't care about what they might say beyond that. O

Reviews.Title: “Was extremely disappointed and disgusted”
Reviews.Author: amc71
Reviews.Content: While turning down the beds after a long day, I discovered what looked to be like larges dried blood stains on both comforters. Needless to say I was completely apalled and turned off by this. We called the front desk immediately and explained the situation. They said they would send housekeeping right up. About 10 minutes later the front desk called back and said they lost the piece of paper that they wrote the note on. Finally, housekeeping arrived and she said, " oh, it looks like food stains from someone eating in bed", practically insinuating that we made the stains. We never even ate in the room! She changed all of the bedding and didn't even apologize for the disgusting circumstances! I spoke to the front desk the next day and all they took off of the $600 + bill was about $42.00. I went with a name brand hotel figuring they would live up to their name but I was gravely mistaken. I would never stay here again. One of the motels probably would have been cleaner and more pleasant to deal with. Also, the food in the restaurant was horrible and the tiny balcony with no chairs to sit on was a huge disappointment. The whole point of having a room with a balcony is to be able to sit outside and enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: katie1117
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! The staff was so friendly and helpful. The outside bar and band could not have been better and it was great to come off the beach for a drink and live music. Our room was fine...hot water, cold air, great bed...we were happy. The Clarion had a nice mix of families, young couples and older folks enjoying themselves. We loved the breakfast buffet and dinner buffet, too.

Reviews.Title: “this place sucks is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: simon1026
Reviews.Content: nice and short-- reserved 2 ajoining rooms and requestes ocean front, a baby crib and nothing higher than the 5th floor. we get there one room is on the 16th floor the other on the 14th floor-- i'm guessing this is ajoining rooms at the clarion. NO baby crib for the 4 month old!!! . Called the front desk to complain about the baby crib and the response was none are available- it's on first come first serve. When I complained to tina at the front desk about to rooms being on different levels her response was--Nothing I can do about it call in the morning and someone else can help you. Things to watch out for at the hell hole-- 1. the balconies are not very safe for young kids. the railing in room 1401 was loose 2. 3 elevators in a 16 story hotel---- nothing beats riding down from the 16th floor and stopping at every floor. Plus there is no weight or person limits posted in the elevator, I contacted state of maryland about this. 3. at $ 350 per night I did not expect to find the last guest left overs in the mini fridge. 4.vending and ice for the 14th floor was conviently placed on the 11th floor 5. it's simply the worst place I have ever stayed at STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBrooke
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Clarion at the advice of a friend and we were not disapointed! Everyone was more than friendly and very helpful. We loved the buffet in the morning and really enjoyed the pool bar and outdoor deck in the afternoon. A big bonus was the waiter service to the beach! We were told this is one of the only hotels that offer this in OC! It was like being at an Island Resort but right here in MD! We even enjoyed a frozen drink while sitting in the sand- awesome! If you are looking for a top notch hotel in OC- this is it!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great vacation and can't wait to come back next year.”
Reviews.Author: jkoder
Reviews.Content: As long as you keep offering the this same hot summer deal, we will return every year. We need a reasonably priced room for a week and as long as we can get one for less than $1000 a week, we will return. We had a great time and everyone was very accomodating and friendly. Food was good and we loved the attention by the wait staff on the beach. It was truly a vacation. Thank you for everything and don't forget to send us those affordable deals. I've already reccommended your hotel to my friends. We want to come back in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and filthier--stay away!”
Reviews.Author: mastertonlaw
Reviews.Content: I have the misfortune of staying at this hotel for a lawyer's conference every year, and every year it gets worse. When I drove up to check in, an apparent vagrant was loitering at the entrance, no valets to be seen.I has reserved a room on the north facing side of the building, knowing from the past that the afternoon band in the outdoor bar at the southeast corner will interfere with work or a nap. The Clarion had no such reservation, so I reiterated my request in person to the check in clerk. The cargo elevator (Filthy, and generally the elevator that comes upon call) brought me to a hallway that clearly had not been vacuumed in days and smelled like a sewage backup. On entering the room, you guessed it--south facing, as well as filthy and smelly. I demanded a change and after a long argument in which the clerk claimed it was my fault they did not have a record of the correct reservation, that I "shouldn't " be bothered by the rock band,and that there were no north facing rooms available, I was moved to the 9th floor (again, via the filthy cargo elevator) to an equally foul room but north facing room. When I stepped off the elevator I noticed a powdery white substance, perhaps a crushed mint, front and center. in the elevator foyer It was still there when I checked out 3 days later--the hallway was never vacuumed during that time, and it looked and smelled as if it was so neglected for a good deal longer! . The fellow who met me to let me in to the room was, to my shock, the vagrant from out front--a hotel employee! This frightening individual kept angling for a tip until I kicked him out. The carpet was filthy and multiply stained. Dust besmirched every surface. I opened the curtain for a look out at the evening, only to find a little pile of candy wrappers never cleaned from prior guests. Gobs of greasy dust coated the vents for the AC. Because of the extensive mildew and foul odor I had to keep the AC running (LOUDLY, I must add) the whole time--so much for ocean breezes through my window.Later, I discovered standing water in the bathtub. EEEEEWWWW. I was truly horrified by the condition of this room but since it was as bad as the first room and the general atmosphere of filth and uncaring staff indicated that more complaining would make no difference, I resigned myself to my lot--which meant touching things as little as possible, not using the shower (!) (or any other item where MRSA could linger, such as their much touted "spa" facility--can you imagine what the steam room is like? The locker rooms? Who would dare put their body in a pool maintained by such managers? For this, I paid a total of $219 each night!!! I just cringed and got through the ordeal until I could leave.--truly, i have stayed at cleaner hotels in 3rd world countries for 1/10 the price. I cannot understand why the Maryland Bar Association continues to patronize this sure y-disease-ridden fly trap. I stay here because all the conference activities are here so there really is no choice. If you have a choice, RUN, DON'T WALK, someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Spend more, it will be worth it”
Reviews.Author: daisy20071960
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one thing going for it, LOCATION. It is right on the beach. The hotel itself is tire and old, it seems that no money is put back into the property. The hallways smell bad, the wallpaper as 1970's "charm", the baseboard carpet was missing from part of my wall showing only dried glue to look at. The lobby has plastic palm trees for decor (that should tell you something)! The bathroom setup is so odd, no door, but a seperate tiny room for the thrown, I weigh 115 lbs and could hardly fit in there. The hotel told me I had no choice but to order the 14.99 buffett for Sunday breakfast so I left and ordered my eggs via roomservice, Hello McFly!!! This hotel was bad a few years ago, and getting worse!

Reviews.Title: “Overall.... great hotel. You get a lot for the money.”
Reviews.Author: toplalm1
Reviews.Content: The prices are very reasonable. The staff was professional and accommodating to my requests. Hotel has a lovely location and my room had an amazing view of the ocean. Room was clean and I truly enjoyed my stay. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “It could be worse...”
Reviews.Author: BoSox92
Reviews.Content: Good set-up. Poor execution. This is a decent choice for families. Do not eat in the indoor restaurants! Awful food and service at an exorbitant price! The outdoor snack area was a better choice. Good band during the Memorial Day weekend. The rooms need work...our AC did not function properly, the safe did not work at all, and the outlet plate to our TV cable was busted, and reception was intermittent.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: eljay247
Reviews.Content: We came to Ocean City for a youth basketball tournament. Our stay was excellent. We really never had to leave the hotel for anything. The hotel was kid friendly and the staff treat us first class. When ever I visit OC, I will be staying at the Clarion!

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: aunthap
Reviews.Content: My stay was comfortable and the room was relatively clean. I provided me with a basic place to stay during my visit. The staff at the front desk were very courteous and efficient, but the concierge was quite loud and obnoxious--the lady at the desk was very embarrassed. Room service was almost an hour late with the first breakfast. No card was left for next day breakfast, but I was not planning to stay for it. Shower head in bathroom is coated with lime, should be cleaned or replaced. Soap dish in tub cracked should be replaced. There was a coke bottle on the balcony with cigarette butts in it. I would have been very disappointed if I paid summer rates for this room in it's current condition. I was thankful that I got the internet rates.

Reviews.Title: “pet-friendly, nice staff, but rooms were dirty and mattress awful”
Reviews.Author: LN87
Reviews.Content: We went down to OC for the last week in April with our dog. The good: the location..right on the beach, the staff was friendly, and they allow pets. The bad: our room was old, dingy, and pretty much everything was stained. The carpet had brown stains all over it as did the sofa and the two upholstered chairs. Yuck. I was afraid to sit. The bathroom had some stains, too, and in obvious need of some upkeep. The mattress was terrible. It was extremely saggy and slipped around the bed. We didn't even bother to open up the sofa bed. Also, the hotel advertises a workout room---it costs something like $4 a day and was pretty lame. Finally, this came in at over $130 for one night (with my AAA discount) in April. Definitely not worth the price. FYI, our pet-friendly room was on the 5th floor. Overall, the hotel itself is nice, liked the indoor pool, loved the location. BUT the pet-friendly room was disgusting and uncomfortable. We'd planned to stay for two nights, but cut it back to one. Would think long and hard about coming again and the only reason I'd consider it is because it is one of the few places that accepts pets.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: RobertaLynn
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was friendly and efficient, the Clarion itself is in need of some serious renovations. It's clearly aging.. For example, even though the weather was cool, the room was warm. The air conditioner didn't work, and we needed to open the sliding doors to make the room comfortable. We could hear our neighbors. Also, the room coffee maker didn't work, and a room privacy tag was missing. The swimming pool was very nice. Still I'd give it another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Fruit and Wine Basket”
Reviews.Author: rkilby
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fine except for the fruit and wine basket I purchased. We came to the Clarion for a short honeymoon weekend and I purchased the fruit and wine basket for I think 38 dollars. What I got was 2 oranges, shriveled grapes, stale crackers and two small twist off bottles of wine. What was in that basket could not of cost more than 10 dollars. Other than that we had a nice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but only fine”
Reviews.Author: NickDC50
Reviews.Content: i wasn't expecting much and so I wasn't disappointed. The room we were initially assigned had no view and it looked like the bed was only half made. So a call to the front desk got a new room, and with a nice view. The room was clean but could definitely use some updating. The beach was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable staff, but...”
Reviews.Author: MDS68
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews about this hotel, I decided to see for myself. First, the staff was extremely friendly, polite and attentive. The dining experience for dinner is terrific. The wine menu easily one of the best on the east coast. I try not to compare one hotel to another, give that a beach location would not be comparable to say - Las Vegas. This being said, the hotel itself showed significant signs of wear and tear relative to its years. Ceiling spots, cracked tile, ventilation were not what I would say well maintained. These are things that can be fixed if one were to put the effort in. Beach view is at an angle, vice a straight oceanfront as in VA Beach. Noise is a major factor here. Both nights sleep was interrupted repeatedly and for long periods due to neighboring vacationers acting as if it's their own home. Slamming doors, screams and general talking/breathing/rattling/banging are very easily heard (and rather interesting for an eight year old). I would suggest that families be given a floor that is away from the boisterous clientele on spring break. Then everyone will be happy and less enlightened. Yes, the front desk was notified. Action taken - not that I was aware of.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: UDGirl
Reviews.Content: I traveled this past weekend with my husband and 6 month old son and the best way to summarize our stay, is to first point out our likes and then our dislikes: Likes: - The room service food was excellent, fast service and very affordable. We definitely took advantage since eating is restaurants with a little one isn't so easy. - The pub next to the pool also had great food and the wait staff was very friendly and personable. - The front desk employees were helpful and friendly. They even granted our initial request to be in a king room! Dislikes: - Our biggest discrepency was that the pool room was freezing on the first day. So much so that our baby's lips turned blue and he started shivering. I called down and the front desk attendant said she was unaware of the problem and that she would have it taken care of. I find it odd that all day not one hotel staff noticed the temperature was freezing? On the second day, it was better, but still chilly and then on the third day, still chilly and the pool water wasn't that warm. We also had to call down to have clean towels delievered to the pool because there was a bin of old ones from the day before; no clean ones. Just very disappointed since this was one of the main reasons we stayed and cold temperature ruined the experience. - The room was not the cleanest; there were white stains on the carpet and the tub drain didn't work properly. - The heater was LOUD! Every time it turned on, it woke all of us up. It was also tempermental; either too cold or too hot; just didn't work properly. There was also a leak in the window and was a pool of water on the heater. - We asked for an extended stay to take a nap, which they granted, but apparently they were fixing the sliding glass doors and the banging and drilling was extremely annoying. No idea why they would start at 9:00 in the morning and not warn the guests staying in the hotel. - We thought it was rediculous that they would charge $4 to use the fitness center; seriously! Our trip overall was enjoyable, but the highlight was not the hotel. I am sure they would have let us switch rooms, but you can imagine all fo the stuff we had to bring for the baby would have made it more of a hassel then a solution. I think next winter we will pay a little more to get the quality we want.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: dgertel
Reviews.Content: We go to the Clarion just to relax after the holidays. For a change of scenery and the fabulous room service. This year we never left the room for our entire stay. It has never disappointed us.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: amirkarimi2
Reviews.Content: The staff are very nice, I requested to have the top floor room and they gave it to me. Great view of the ocean and you can just fall asleep to the sound of waves crashing outside the window. Most nights they have a band at their restaurant which serves decent food at a reasonable price; It's a couple of blocks away from some really good restaurants, and about 10 min north of the boardwalk. I'd definitely stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “the start of a new holiday tradition”
Reviews.Author: pupsnus
Reviews.Content: I have already recommended this hotel to several of my friends and aquaintences. The staff at the hotel were exceptional. When I first arrived for our little holiday getaway, we were not real happy with the room. It was overlooking the roof and parking lot and you really couldn't see much of the ocean. It was very disappointing to my wife and I thought we were in for a very long weekend. My wife went to the front desk and asked about changing rooms for a better view and the manager said that it would be no problem. She showed my wife a new room, room 509 and it was 100 times better then what we were just in. The manager asked sincerely if the room would be okay and we, in unison, said a very satisfied "yes!". The stay only got better, we had our small puppies with us and they loved the dog park, it was easy access to the beach and the restaurant staff as well as the wonderful Christmas Buffet made this trip a new traditional place to go. I want to thank all of your staff and cooks, tremendous! My wife weighs just over a hundred pounds but because of the great food, ate more than I have ever seen her eat. Bravo and we will see you next year!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, very professional, very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: Frank67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid December to get away for a few days. Sometimes we like to stay in places during quiet times just to relax and unwind a little. We arrived on a Friday night. Although the hotel wasn't sold out, they had what seemed to be a full staff, all of the main areas were fully operational including the bar, restaurant, gift shop, raw bar and a band scheduled for the weekend. Breakfast the next morning included a buffet and cook to order eggs and waffles. It was very good. The seafood in the restaurant and raw bar was fresh and the portions were generous. The gym had a good amount of cardio machines, a separate weight room, co-ed sauna, steam room,jacuzzi &eucalytus room and kept very clean. The hotel is located on the beach in North Ocean City and there is plenty nearby to do. If you are planning a trip to this area, I would highly recommend staying here. I was impressed with the friendlieness of all of the staff, the cleanliness of the hotel and the way we were treated as guests. Please understand that this is a beach hotel and looks to be a few years old, so there may be a hair or two out of place, but every effort is made to stay on top of keeping it nice. We look foward to returning in the summer. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and so much more”
Reviews.Author: dawnie13
Reviews.Content: We decided to get away for a few days in October and decided on the Fontainebleau because we wanted an ocean view and an indoor pool @ a reasonable cost. Our room was ready even though we arrived over an hour before check-in starts. The lobby is small but attractive and the staff efficient. We were really thrilled to find a 10th floor room with both Bay and ocean views from the sofa in the room and the tiny balcony off our room. The weather was sunny and very warm, so we did enjoy the balcony a bit. The very clean room had two doubles a sofabed , a microwave, fridge with freezer. The beds had an under pad that kept bunching up and unfortunately gave us trouble sleeping. I would recommend the management try to fix that with a fitted under pad. The hair drier was great in the bathroom as was the sunlamp for after shower warmth. There is a tub and shower and plenty of nice fresh towels to use. Housekeeping did a fine job and maintenance came immediately to open our locked safe and fix the key entry to our door when asked. There are two restaurants in the hotel that look fine but we ate all of our meals out this time. The pub menu seemed well priced and we would not hesitate to try it next time. The best thing about our stay, however, was the heated indoor pool which we used for hours both days. We were also given free entry to the spa facilities which are unbelievable: Loads of exercise equipment; a great steam room; a sauna; eucalyptus room, and huge clean powerful and HOT hot tub!! We enjoyed it all and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricy and cramped for larger families”
Reviews.Author: Prof-B-NJ
Reviews.Content: There’s a lot to like about this hotel. It’s right on the beach and the pool is nice. We rarely dine at a hotel’s restaurant(s), as one can usually find better food at better prices at places that aren’t attached to a hotel. Had to make an exception here - the pub and the bar & grill had great food at reasonable prices. The live entertainment was actually pretty good. However, their main restaurant (Horizons) was prohibitively expensive for a family of 5. The room was also a little tight for a family with 3 younger teens, and getting 2 rooms is far too expensive in season. They don't have the option of slightly larger rooms/suites for larger families. So, smaller families might find the rooms more comfortable than we did. We’d consider going back, but not until one or more kids is grown and not coming along on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: redhedgehog
Reviews.Content: Queen size beds turned out to be regular full size. Bathroom was very shabby, with cracked tile and sink. Balcony slider didn't fit well and rain poured through cracks to soak floor. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay but could use updating,”
Reviews.Author: tennisaceColumbia
Reviews.Content: The restaurant is pretty good and definitely a good value. The hotel needs updating. The people at the bell station are exceptional at the desk not so hot.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: RobertECroneJr
Reviews.Content: My mom and I decided to plan a vacation at the beach, as we do every year, and this was the first time we had chosen Ocean City, MD, in probably fifteen years. We chose the Clarion due to it's very reasonable rate, the amenities, the ocean view from our room and, of course, it's location directly on the beach. The major disappointment during our trip, which had NOTHING to do with the hotel, was the weather. It rained the entire time we were at the beach (Monday, Sept 7 - Friday, Sept 11). The trip was full of mixed emotions because of the weather, as you can imagine. However, just about everything at the hotel met or exceeded our expectations. Here's a review of our experience at The Clarion: 1. The front desk staff at check in was very nice. The lobby of the hotel is very inviting and you definitely feel like you're at the beach when you enter the hotel. All of the staff members are wearing tropical button up shirts and there are many different things in the lobby that reflect the bright colors of what a tropical paradise would be expected to look like. 2. There is a business center right off of the main lobby that is only accesible with your room key. It features two high speed internet computers and a printer. I don't have a lap top (just a desk top at home) so it was nice to have access to the computers to check my personal email and to explore info about Ocean City. Of course, another thing to note: There is a concierge in the hotel who appeared to be available to answer any questions regarding things to do in Ocean City. We did not use the services of the concierge. 3. Our room was on the 9th floor and looked EXACTLY like the room that's featured on the website's virtual tour. The room was great. It was very spacious. There was a microwave and fridge (the microwave seemed a little older as we had a hard time opening it several times -- however, with determination, it would finally open). There were two double beds that were very comfortable (unfortunately, the pillows had a musty smell to them but my Mom and I always travel with Febreeze. We Febreezed them every day and they eventually were fine). There was a couch in the room and a nice table and chairs that could have been used as a desk or a dining table. There were three chairs around the table. And then of course one of our favorite features, was the 'standing room only' balcony.
