We noticed upon checking in that the screen door on the sliding doors had a tear in it and we didn't want to be held responsible for this damage since we, of course, had nothing to do with it. We called the front desk and it was replaced immediately. We were VERY impressed. As well, the bathroom was very spacious and plenty of towels and wash cloths were provided. Also, their bath products are made by Neutrogena and we really enjoyed using them. 4. Upon our first night of arriving, we didn't feel like going out for dinner, so we decided to order room service. The food came from the in house restaurant called "Horizons". I had a Chicken Ceasar Salad and my Mom had Chicken Breast topped with Crab Meat and a special sauce, a baked potato, some sort of vegetable, bread and she got a pot of coffee and we had glasses of water. My salad was delicious and Mom's dish (I had to taste it, of course) was beyond words! It was so good it melted in your mouth. The gentleman who brought the food in was very nice but for the price, I guess I expected him to help us set things up like a waiter would, but he didn't. The tip was included in the order so we spent $12.00 on his just brining our meal up (a 15% tip is included on room service orders). He literally set everything on the coffee table and just left. I guess I expected more but maybe I'm wrong in doing so. Regardless, the food was great! 5. Since it rained the entire time, Mom and I did a lot of sleeping in each morning, shopping, eating out and movie watching. 6. Horizons, the restaurant on the property, had a live band peform each night from 9 p.m. - ?. Bars are not are thing so we didn't go down for that but we did agree this was a nice thing to have for guests so you literally didn't have to go anywhere while you're vacationing. 7. I did use the indoor pool twice and I thought it could be a little bit cleaner than it was. The water temperature was perfect. I was the only one in the pool (while my Mom sat pool side and read), but each time I swam, many, many long hairs would get tangled in my fingers and I even had to swipe a few out of my mouth (I'm bald, so I know they weren't my hairs). As well, in the bootm of the pool you could see large strips of sand that seemed to form near a drain at the bottom. Then, several tables had trash on them from where I assume guests had been sitting and eating and drinking (technically I don't think you're allowed to eat near the pool); it amazes me how lazy people can be when they're out and can't clean up after themselves. There were trash cans all over the place. 8. There was a covered outdoor seating area that appeared to be part of the outdoor dining area when the weather was probably nicer but it was available to guests for smoking (the entire hotel is 100% smoke free with designated smoking areas on the property). My Mom is a smoker (I'm not) so it was nice for us to go sit there while it was raining so we could watch the big waves, relax and people watch. Each time we were passed by a Clarion Hotel employee we were always greeted and small talk always ensued. The Clarion also has it's own private beach and during the peak season there's a bar that's outside and an uncovered seating area with tables and chairs surrounded by tropical flowers and trees. 9. The only unfriendly employee that we came across was a bellman who was pushy and appeared to only have his agenda as a priority. On several occasions, Mom and I would return from being out and would come through the main entrance of the hotel. As we would be working our way toward the elevator, this man would apparently be loading up another guest's luggage onto a luggage cart to take to their room. More than once, he literally pushed the luggage cart right in front of us and would take the elevator that we had been waiting for. Now this may sound trivial or childish, there's a point about the story. We were a guest and we were just as important as the guest he was servicing. We felt like he was working for a tip and really disregarded anyone else in the lobby except for the people he was servicing. He just seemed very aloof and unaware of anything else that was going on around him. Things like this annoy me. If you're in line waiting for ANYTHING, you shouldn't jump the line. Of course, I didn't say anything while we were at the hotel because Mom kept telling me to let it go. Of course, I wanted to include it here. 10. Last but not least, there were two gift shops on the premises. There was a jewelry store that my Mom enjoyed visiting and then there was a general type of gift shop that offered small souvenirs, snacks, post cards and such. I think it would have been nice if the gift shop carried a little more selection of small gifts but I'm sure the size of the gift shop had something to do with it. Also, on the same floor of the gift shops and the restaurants appeared to be where the convention center activities were. There seemed to be a couple of conventions going on while we were there and though that could seem like a disruption to vacationers, it actually was nice to see that many people meandering around the hotel. There was a spa available, too, on this floor (which was caleld the Terrace) but we did not use their services. There was one other restaurant/bar that was open (and I can't think of their name to save my life). In closing, I want to say that we were quite pleased with the hotel. We didn't get housekeeping service every single day but the one day we went out late after sleeping in and lounging (remember, we had TONS of rain) we called for housekeeping services and to our surprise they sent someone right up. It was almost 3 p.m. and we thought it was mosly likely too late to get the room cleaned up Every housekeeper we came into contact with was very friendly and offered great customer service. We definitely tipped them! Again, it rained EVERY SINGLE DAY! We literally went on the beach for about ten minutes the first day because the wind gusts were anywhere from 20 - 40 mph and a couple of days it rained a minimum of 2 to 4 inches of rain! Even when we'd try to stand on the 'standing only' balcony, we would get pelted with rain drops that were coming down so hard it hurt!

Reviews.Title: “Best ocean vacation yet!!”
Reviews.Author: PA-IndianRider
Reviews.Content: On the day we made reservations to stay at The Clarion Fontainbleau Hotel (101 St.) was an indication of how perfect our vacation was going to be. When I mentioned to the Clarions reservation manager ( Donna Tr) we celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary she certainly went out of her way to make our stay "perfect"...... and it was!!! The room, (pet-friendly suite), restaurants, beach bar, health club, amenities and especially the "refreshing" friendly staff combined to make our stay one of the best vacations we ever had. Daily entertainment afternoons (at the beach bar) & nightly (at the night club) was "top shelf" making it unnecessary to leave the hotel. Another reason not to leave the hotel was the "excellent cruisine" at the hotel's restaurant.... especially the seafood buffet. If all this wasn't enough ..... the hotel also had a very nice gift shop.... having everything from trinkets to fine jewerly.... I purchased the perfect "anniversary gift" (ring) there as not only a symbol of our 10th anniversary but as a "reminder" of the "perfect vacation" we had celebrating it at the " Clarion Fontainebleau Resort Hotel" in

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: terpsgirl3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a short weekend trip, since we live in Maryland. We had a condo in OC when I was a kid, so I was unfamiliar with the hotel options in Ocean City. I read reviews and received a special rate email, so I decided to check it out. The private beach was a HUGE PLUS, you are able to take drinks from their tiki bar out onto the beach with you and enjoy them there, unlike most of OC. The staff at the front desk was very pleasant and so were the doormen.

Reviews.Title: “A step above the rest of Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Skihouse132
Reviews.Content: We spent our Anniversary weekend in June at the Clarion with our Dog. We had previously checked in to one of the two other hotels that allows dogs in OC (Serene), but left immediately due in general disgust with the filthiness of the hotel and room. We were able to get a last minute room here, so luckily the weekend was saved. We were completely blown away with the staff, the location (right on the beach) and quality of the Clarion. Lots to do onsite too- pools, restaurant, bars, beach access. Summary- If we go back to Ocean City, the Clarion is the only hotel I would consider staying at. *Side note related to Dogs in Ocean City- Dogs are not allowed any beaches in Ocean City during the summer, but if you travel north about 15 minutes to the assateague national seashore (not the state park) dogs are allowed on-leash.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: cvandenbraak
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in the hotel in August for a conference. The check-in was quick with room ready for me. The room was spacious, clean and modern. Bathroom was clean and well stocked with everything I needed.The room was an ocean view which was an added bonus! I had dinner at the outside bar area. Service was good and prices was reasonable. This is a dog friendly hotel and I enjoyed seeing all the dogs with their family on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous!”
Reviews.Author: gdynamo
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about the excellent service, quality and professionalism of each and every one of the staff members from the reservationist to the housekeeping staff. When we first arrived, we discovered the adjoining rooms requested were not available. The desk manager was able to relocate us in a condo unit (which, btw, was our original choice). The rooms were spacious and all amenities were perfect. We have already discussed our vacation for next year at this location. Thank you all for making our stay "one of the best ever!"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, great value, helpful staff - everything you could want in one place, and then some”
Reviews.Author: lindasun
Reviews.Content: We booked about two weeks prior to our arrival and got a great Internet rate. Reviews on TripAdvisor, including replies from the hotel, helped me choose the Clarion over some other places we were considering. The Internet special rate gave us a good deal, $180/night. Due to a booking error, we ended up with an ocean view room without paying the extra cost for it, which was very nice. It was an excellent value. We traveled with two children under 10 and my mother, who is elderly and not very mobile. The Clarion had everything we could want. - Ample parking right there. - We walked right onto the private beach. The ocean water was warm and waves were wonderful. Lifeguards were attentive. Umbrellas and chairs were available for renting. Boogie boarding was permitted (unlike at nearby Assateague). Plenty of sprayers to wash off before entering the hotel. - The hotel had beach wheelchairs available for our use, which my mother needed. They also loaned us a regular wheelchair for convenience when ours was in the car. - The indoor and outdoor pools were perfect and gave the kids endless hours of fun - warm, not too crowded, ample towels, sizable, with attentive but not overbearing lifeguards. There was an outdoor jacuzzi too. From the pools, you could hear the band playing, and order a drink or food. - The bar overlooked the beach and had great drinks and decent food for kids and adults, without being a ripoff. We hadn't expected to go there but hit it every day for a nice break after the beach. There was a bank, which was pleasant, and fine service. - As a bonus, my younger child enjoyed the clown with her face painting and great balloon animals, while my older child and husband really loved the lesson from the champion boogie boarder, provided gratis, on the beach two evenings. Who knew you could stand on a boogie board or do 360s'? - Free wifi in the room was also most welcome. - The staff was very helpful and friendly. The concierge provided advice on where to kayak, helped us load up during busy check out time, and assisted with whatever we needed. As noted earlier, they handled a booking error well. Our air conditioner broke one day and they had it replaced within 30 minutes. - The health club was great including a steam room, sauna, hot whirlpool, and eucalyptus room. - The location was fine. We ended up driving to the boardwalk and parking due to my mom's need for a wheelchair and found that to be convenient. - The hotel allows dogs, but that wasn't a problem for non dog owners, like us. They were cute but not obnoxious. - All the basics were spot on: clean room, friendly service, amenities, etc. - Anything to complain about? Not really. An occasional wait for elevators during busy checkin and checkout times, the original room mixup, but minor inconveniences. We might have liked a bigger gift shop. Having never been to Ocean City, we enjoyed what it had to offer - the beach, the boardwalk, crabs, and Assateague Island. My kids dubbed it the best hotel ever. We like to try different vacation spots, but if we returned to Ocean City, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable trip with very good service”
Reviews.Author: bolivarpa
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed here for nearly 15 years. Now with three children between 11yrs and 4 yrs old, we decided they needed to see the ocean. We arrived on saturday around noon and we were provided with a parking permit and told to enjoy full use of the facilities until our room was cleaned. They even cleaned the room 1.5 hours early. Extra pillows were no problem. Our room was at the end of the hallway nearest the ocean and was cleaned very early and was nice and quiet. I knew of the small balconies from previous stays, but with everything to do, this is not an issue. The indoor and outdoor pools were a blessing for the children, as hurricane bill made for a rough beach for the kids. They enjoyed the ocean, but it did wear them out. Thank you Clarion, we are already planning our stay for next year. I hope I can get the same room, as it was a perfect fit.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice place if you want to spend a couple of days without hassle in OC”
Reviews.Author: stealers
Reviews.Content: It has everything you need for the Beach, a bar, restaurant, indoor pool, nice size room with fridge/freezer/microwave. The balcony has a great view of the ocean and the bay as it sits on the side of the building. The only issues is the balcony is too small for a chair.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Sediv
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit the bill for what we were looking for - a clean reasonably appointed hotel wiht a location right on the beach for a reasonable price. The rooms were spacious and increadibly quiet - there was a baby in the room next to ours and we never heard him/her once inside of our room. The staff at the hotel was reasonably pleasant. Things that could be better at the hotel: they need a dedicated service elevator - the elevator situation was slow enough already without precious space being occupied by rolling bins of linens, food, trash, etc; they need more bell carts - its ridiculous that a hotel this size only has 3 carts available for guests (they keep a few aside for bell boys). Another negative is the balcony - there is barely enough room for 2 adults to stand on it at the same time so forget about sitting out there and enjoying the beach view (remember this is beach view not ocean front). Inspite of certain shortfalls, I would definitely consider staying here again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with all the amenities you need in one hotel!”
Reviews.Author: musicjustintime
Reviews.Content: Really loved our stay with you. Also loved the private beach, how CLOSE we were to it, and that our balcony had a GREAT view of the beach AND the bay! Couldn't ask for more in a room. Also, we really liked the fact that there were places to eat, drink, swim (TWO POOLS!), and just hang out, ALL in the same hotel. Leila (spelling?) was fun to pick on and chat with, as was Carla, and crazy P.J. at Lenny's! Very nice staff, and the elevators were PRETTY darn quick, too! Only "BAD" thing...if you want to call it bad...was that when we first arrived, our balcony door wouldn't open...but the service man came up RIGHT away and fixed it! Even our cat "Bob" felt at home, and enjoyed sleeping his days away under the big chair...and looking out the balcony window! Can't wait to come back, and would love to have our same room, too, if that's at all possible?! Thank you my friends, and hope to see you next summer! God Bless and "ciao for now!" Justin

Reviews.Title: “Great beach resort for fun and relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: pollock109
Reviews.Content: With the addition of the new outdoor pool, the Clarion is "tops" for Ocean City fun and relaxation. Great for families but also great for older adults who want to enjoy what a beach resort can offer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has a great combination of location, amenities, and convenience.”
Reviews.Author: primroselife
Reviews.Content: Well-equipped room, but little counter space (best to unpack here). Hotel has outdoor bar & grill with great beach atmosphere. The children's activities and playground are nice features. Beach is very nice and outdoor showers and even spray nozzles are available right at entrance from beach. Beach equipment rentals also are available. The indoor and outdoor pools are somewhat dirty, but water cleanliness may be hard enforce and maintain in a beachfront hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars My Foot”
Reviews.Author: USMCFamilyOf6
Reviews.Content: The common areas (lobby, pool, restaurant, ball rooms, etc.) all seem to be well kept. The wait for the elevator was always ridiculous. They need to make haste to install another because the three they have are obviously not sufficient to serve the entire building. Also, the room was not very clean. We found dirty sandy sheets on the sleeper sofa. The staff was happy to deliver a clean set, but offered no apology. The bathroom was full of mold, had sand in the tub, dirty walls and dirty floor. I have asthma so I immediately went out and bought some mold killing bathroom cleaner and cleaned the bathroom myself. Unfortunately the problem goes beyond a good scrubbing. You can see the mold creeping in from behind the drop-ceiling tiles in the bathroom. We kept the bathroom door closed as much as possible, but my asthma was acting up the whole time. Part of the problem, I believe, is due to the very weak ventilation system in the bathroom. The bathroom vent fan doesn't circulate much air and I wonder if it is even vented to the outside. It is really a shame that this is the case, because the rest of the hotel is nice. Most of the employees were pleasant. The food was very good. My parents loved the fact that you could order meals on the beach or poolside and charge it to the room. My children had a great time in the pools and at the beach. But I really could not recommend it to any of my friends based on the dirty bathroom. I can't believe that they would expect someone to bathe their children in that filth.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING STAY”
Reviews.Author: petvaca
Reviews.Content: The stay was hassle free. Love the option of being able to bring a pet. Room cleanliness was just ok. Not sure if put in so so room because of pet. Love the access to beach and restaurants. Staff were all very friendly.The only complaint I have is we stayed about a month ago and I left something in my room and didn't realize it until we arrived home. I called a total of 4 times and still have never rec a call back from houskeeping. I have now written my item off as lost. Probably would not have rebooked if it wasn't for dog friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: badvacation96
Reviews.Content: We had to move three times. The 1st time,the location of our room was not good. It was over the air conditions units for the whole floor and was very noisy. The 2nd time, the dogs on the floor kept barking. On the 3rd move, the room was ok but there was mold in the bathroom and the wallpaper was coming down.

Reviews.Title: “quite pleasant”
Reviews.Author: dimplez
Reviews.Content: It's not high society but it was clean, staff were friendly, the new outdoor pool is bromine treated and while it looked small was just right. The beach was super nice and both pool and beach so convenient. There were activities for the kids in the a.m. and p.m. The breakfast buffet was affordable and good and the nightly buffet in the ballroom was...FANTASTIC! WOW! food food food and then some food on the side.

Reviews.Title: “Listen, it's not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mrspeart
Reviews.Content: I went with my hubby and three kids and as soon as we walked in we encountered attitude. Why? we are still trying to figure this out. The receptionist (both) were not friendly at all and don't try to ask them a question, its as if you are annoying them with one question. Our room was average but had mold growing on the bath tub. I requested a new room because of my small chuildren and they moved me to another room, with less mold on the tub. The 4th floor has balconies and when I called to see why ours was sealed shut they said because we did not pay for an oceanview even though we were able to see the beach and ocean from our room. It's really not worth the almost $250 per night that we paid but this was our 1st time in OC. We orginally ignored the bad reviews, don't.

Reviews.Title: “Average is the right wording to resume our stay at the Clarion”
Reviews.Author: FrankFromMTL
Reviews.Content: Pros - Clean place, clean room, good service, free wireless internet Cons - Only 3 Elevator (one was out of service for a full day also), bed were small and unconfortable, carpet was always wet beside the A/C, A/C was noisy, very old TV with a remote that had tape to old the battery door, there was a gap between the patio door and the window so when it was windy we always hear it banging. Sorry but not enough Pros to recommand that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THe perfect spot for us, we WILL BE BACK@!!!”
Reviews.Author: mummytothree
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with this accom., from friendly staff to excellent entertainment for our littleones ( 5 yr. old twins, one 7 yr.old). The magic show was fun and even the adults laughed. The clown was such a sweetie, "A Grandma", my kids said. The thing I liked the most was that everything was right there, a live band nightly, good food, and of course the beach. The ONly thing I was unhappy with was the carpet in the room did not look clean, but I promptly used my Lysol just for my own peice of mind. Other than that, the beds were clean and comfy and the bathroom was clean. We will definitely choose this hotel agian next year.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best, and why did TA give it 4 stars??”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob96
Reviews.Content: We arrived after check in and got our room, the elevators are very slow beware, and our room wasn't actually ready until 4:20. The front desk was kind and courteous, but the rooms weren't that great. One of ours didn't have a sofabed like promised, 903, but the other one, 904 did. The balcony was really sad! It wasn't that clean, but its a Clarion. The location was amazing, except the beach was crowded. Lenny's was fairly good, we rented beach stuff which was a good value. Can't believe the exercise rooms cost money, even though it is a full "spa" the fitness centre should be free. Stay at one of the Holiday Inns, the Hilton, or the Courtyard, look much nicer and stayed at the Holiday inn on 65th!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Roses5
Reviews.Content: We were a little skeptical about visiting Ocean City for the first time with all three of our kids. I had never stayed in a Clarion before either. We very pleasantly surprised when we first arrived at the hotel. The parking was ample, the lobby was just beautiful and each an every time we passed an employee, we were greeted with a smile and greeting. I was very impressed. The pools were kept very clean with a generous supply of clean pool towels. Lenny's restaurant on the beach was great. Typical bar food, but with awesome service and great for lunch when you can't get the kids out of the pool or off the beach. The "All you can eat" dinner was, well, blah, and pricey, so unless you can eat a lot, I would not recommend it. The rooms were spotless although the bath tubs could use a little updating. And if you needed any service, they were extremely fast and willing to help you. The beach was SPOTLESS! And it was private, so that made it a little nicer. Some things to remember...bring beach towels; they don't allow pool towels to be brought to the beach. Bring a beach chair. Rentals are available and were very reasonable at $5.00 per day or $20 for a week. They also rent umbrellas. The beach bar and grill will deliver your food or drinks to your spot on the beach as well!! They offered free body-boarding lessons for people of all ages! There were some activities for the little kids as well. The magic show was free and we were very impressed! All in all, we had a wonderful time and are seriously considering this tto become an annual trip for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to wait for elevators!”
Reviews.Author: BigFrank2009
Reviews.Content: A friendly staff and adequate rooms couldn't make up for the abysmal elevator service. 16 floor resort hotel with only 3 elevators! During our stay, one of the elevators was in and out of service. It could take you up to 15mins to get an elevator to stop at your floor. Every room has a view of the ocean just don't expect to fit more than one adult on the "balcony" at a time. The private beach behind the hotel was pretty dirty. There were a lot of cigarette butts throughout the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: MrMovie500
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Ocean City and wasn't quite sure what to expect. I found the hotel to be very pleasant. The pool was a bit small but well situated right next to the outside bar that had live music every afternoon - which was definitely a plus. The beach right in front of the hotel was clean and well served by the waitress from the bar. I enjoyed sitting out on the beach with a chair and umbrella sipping on a margarita. The room was clean and modern and I appreciated the safe in the room. I liked the way the balcony looked out over both the beach and the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: hjmtmd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. The room was very clean and quite. The staff were more than helpful. The only thing that my family and I were surprised with was that the hotel did not offer a free continental breakfast and the balcony was a bit tiny. Overall we had a very nice time and I look forward to coming back in the future. Thanks. The Miller Family

Reviews.Title: “Great family place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: noloser
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and being right on the ocean was awesome. Plus having an indoor and outdoor pool was great. The kids would leave the beach and go to the pool until they closed. Room service was excellent. Anytime we called and needed any thing they were right there. If I could say anything negative it would be the bathrooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “had alot of fun”
Reviews.Author: eaglesNy
Reviews.Content: my only criticism is that this was the worst room we ever had in the 4 years that we stayed there. room 518 had a leaky faucet, bad tv remote, ripped screen leading to balcony, poor door lock and worst of all i hated the view. i prefer the opposite side of the hotel so when i look to the right i see the beach instead of rt 1. we couldnt see the sunrise from this room. other than that hotel and staff are awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great price!”
Reviews.Author: denlem
Reviews.Content: Typically we stay on the boardwalk, but a friend I traveled with has stayed here in the past without problems. Needed something cheaper, so here we come! Reservations were booked online and was a smooth as can be. Got a good rate which was almost half of the boardwalk hotel. Check in was smooth, although they do have a late 4pm check in time. Driving 400+ miles I do like to leave early for less traffic, so that means arrival early and you have to wait if your room isn't ready yet. I found this site after booking and got nervous after reading some of the negative reviews. I got up to the room and eveything looked fine, clean, and in place. During the stay, housekeeping had the rooms made up early and quickly. The food at Lennys was great. We ate there more than we expected since we liked it, the price was reasonable and the serving size was plentiful. The nachos, chicken fingers, and burgers were great. Todd the bartender, who I think was just starting there made an awsome Long Island Iced Tea. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay. The other positive comments you read here I did experience. The staff was very friendly, front desk at check in/out were very social, and walking by the staff or meeting them in an elevator they always greeted. I wish I could remember their names to give them the credit they deserve. The only complaint I do have is with housekeeping. Whoever cleaned the rooms the first few nights was very tight on soap and shampoo. Once one is opened, it should have been replaced with another one. That didn't happen. We found ourselves chasing some down a few times. Towards the end of the week, someone different must have been doing the cleaning since everything was filled properly. Even the toilet paper end was neatly folded back. Overall, it was a nice place to stay, with issues to really complain about. I would have no problem coming back and staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: tulolymars
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days...a great experience...the beach bar was a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I imagined”
Reviews.Author: aLeash727
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Indoor and out door pools along with a private beach. The bartenders and serves will come around and take your order while you are lounging by the pool and they are very friendly. Every employee that walked by me smiled and greeted me. The room was big and had a microwave and mini fridge so we could bring our own lunch meat and snacks and saved money that way. They also had live bands inside and out that were great! I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Every staff member made us feel like honored guest”
Reviews.Author: tob7inc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night on Memorial Day weekend on a lark and were so happily surprised to discover this gem of a getaway resort. Indoor and outdoor pool w/hot tub. Chaise lounge bar and food service. Steps to a beautiful beach. Clean, large very comfortable rooms. Reasonably priced gift shop. Top notch seafood and prime rib buffet followed by a fun live band that played every request we had. We danced the night away. Best of all was the very friendly BUT excellent customer service from every staff member we encountered. And PET friendly. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: lmroy88
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the location directly on the beach - an immediate hit with the kids. The new outdoor pool was an added plus even though it's pretty small. Loved the live afternoon band. The food at the outdoor grill was plentiful and tasty. Some drawbacks were the cramped parking area, tiny dog park, the unfriendly front desk staff, and the excessive room rate. The rooms (beds, furnishings, bathrooms) have not been updated in many, many years and it shows very well. Was appalled that they wanted to charge me to use the fitness center. We'd return only because we can bring our 4-legged family member.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Think About It...”
Reviews.Author: Dayj81
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I booked this hotel because it seemed to be the nicest hotel in OC that is pet friendly and affordable. When I got there the check in was smooth and the staff was friendly. But when I got to my room and went to the bathroom I noticed there were no hand towels or wash cloths, the toilet tissue wasn't changed and the toilet seat was dirty (like cigarette ashes on it). I work in a boutique hotel and know what a cleaned bathroom should look like. I was slightly uncomfortable with that, but since it seemed that the rest of the room had been cleaned, I overlooked it. I later learned that the toilet kept running every so many minutes, which started to get annoying, but figured I could just close the bathroom door. What made my experience extremely disgusting was when I was ready to get in the bed, only to pull the sheets back and see a blood stain. Not a little sprinkle but a large enough stain that no one could miss. I would've taken a picture but didn't think to do so until after I was in the new room. It was so disgusting because housekeeping took the time to make the bed perfectly and fluff the pillows, but didn't bother to change the bed linen. I called the front desk for them to switch my room, and they called right back and told me to come get my key. I went downstairs to get my key to the new room (which ended up being directly across the hall), but wasn't given any kind of apology from the staff, they didn't bother to comp my room, half of my stay or even give me a credit for room service or any other form of compensation for this disgusting experience. Needless to say I wouldn't eat in a place that didn't change their sheets, but I did frequent the bar. The highlight of this stay was the bartender, Kevin. He would be the ONLY reason I go back here and that would just be the happy hour. I didn't sleep well, as I only kept thinking that the pillows and sheets in the new room weren't 100% clean either and probably weren't changed since there were no obvious stains (not that that mattered). So I slept on top of the sheets, and kept my arm between my face and the pillow. The hotel is pretty far from the boardwalk, as the hotel is located on 101 St., and the heart of the boardwalk is around 2nd Street. You do the math, and do not try walking. However they do have a private beach which is nice, but just know that it's far from the boardwalk and the majority of people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend with my4grandbabies”
Reviews.Author: my4grandbabies
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my grandchildren on a weekend adventure, we packed up the mini van, starting out from South Jersey i grandchild aboard, picking up my other 3 little ones in Delaware, head south on 95 to OC Maryland they would guess where they were going one said camping, the other said place with a pool and my oldest said she wanted to watch for clues as going, the littlest just said an adventure. When we finally got to Ocean City they said is it a hotel or motel ? Then we pulled up and they were so excited they said Mom-Mom you rock. As we entered they were so impressed with the bell man the friendly staff at the front desk, our experience at your hotel was fabulous. We enjoyed the restaurant, room service, wake up call. The pool was definitely a big hit. Sunday we had to leave the called for the bell man and a friendly bell girl arrived. Our experience was wonderful and I would definitely do it again. Thank you !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Roomy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: smitho1972
Reviews.Content: Remember this is not a 5 star property. For a 3 star property, it has great quality. The hotel and more importantly the room were clean and comfortable. Studio King room was well equipped and large. Ocean view had better than expected ocean view from tiny balcony. Bathroom was small but clean with neutral decor. The property is relatively small which was nice when making runs to the bar or the gift shop. However, a conference filled the hotel making parking and elevators challenging. (nice group of people though!!) We found the staff friendly and helpful. We enjoyed great happy hour deals on both food and drinks at the bar. Were not wowed by Sunday breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels shouldnt be so rude during an economic crunch.”
Reviews.Author: green_saber83
Reviews.Content: To be honest this was the worst experience ever, without even getting to enjoy my stay I arrived on the forth @ midnight although knowing in hotel language that ment the midnight of the third, I had previously called to confirm my check in with the desk that afternoon and stated that I would be arriving very early from a long and stressfull meeting and would there be a early check in fee. I was told there would be no problem to come anyway. When I arrived @ the front desk I was excited to spend some quality time with my partner only to find out my room was not going to be ready untill 3 pm. When I asked if I could get a room untill my own was ready the hotel wanted to charge me an extra 30 dollars than what I had paid previously over hotwaire and would not match it. I was treated very poorly by the staff and by some woman wearing a shroud of dead animals on her back claiming to be the owner of the hotel. I was so aggrivated by the service I just decided to get back into my car and go home. This hotel will never get serivce EVER from my company or myself, friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: needcoffee
Reviews.Content: Get past the fact that you are in Ocean City (and all of its glorious cheeziness), get past the outdated lobby, and the Clarion is not a bad place to spend a long weekend. Our room was large and much nicer than the exterior or lobby of the hotel hinted at. We had a little balcony with a view of the ocean, and a micro-fridge. The bathroom was tiny and outdated. We liked the fact that the property was located on the beach, and that it had a pool. The hotel is located a few miles from the OC Boardwalk, if this is an issue to you (it was not for us). I can't speak to the price, as we got a discounted conference rate. My husband, toddler son, and I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: wentag29
Reviews.Content: Was a little hesitant after reading some not so good reviews, but was able to get an EXCELLENT rate thru Expedia and we took a chance. Loved it. No wait for the elevators, clean room, comfortable bed, coffee, paper and all the little amenities. Yes, it's a distance from the boardwalk, but we knew that in advance and the private beach more than made up for that. You could DRINK on the beach or stroll up to the bar which was right there. Even the bands weren't bad. The place wasn't over run with animals or kids, but at a few points I DID feel like I was in the movie "Cocoon". But I'd much rather watch some classy elderly people have a good time, than put up with a bunch of loud college students anyway. If you're in the mood for raucous (and who isn't occasionally), the bus stop for the drunk bus is right out front. The balcony IS small, but you can see the bay and the ocean just fine from there or even from inside the room. We've stayed at the Carousel before, but I thought it was way overpriced. We paid so much more for a room there where our view was of nothing but an air conditioning unit. I loved the Clarion and my bf agreed it's the best place we've stayed yet in the 10 yrs we've been going down to OC. It wasn't perfection, but it was more than adequate and very nice and we'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great - I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: iamloved
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as bad as some of the very low end beach motels, but it's not the quality I would expect from the Clarion brand. The furnishings and bed linens are dated and worn. The hotel really needs to update the rooms. This is definitely not a resort hotel as the name implies. Oceanview is a sliver of cement that can hold 1 person and actually faces the side of the hotel next door. The fitness center was small & uncomfortable and had a wet, musty feel. The hotel is further away from attractions than some nicer properties. You can do much better in this price range. It does have nice meeting facilities if you are with a business group, but I would not want to attend the meeting if this was my choice for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Momondago
Reviews.Content: For less money, we could have stayed in a hotel that was closer to the attractions, had a better view, and had larger rooms with larger beds. I reluctantly agreed to stay here with a group. When we got there, two of our rooms did not have any hand towels or washcloths and one didn't have a TV remote. The drain for the tub was clogged. They make it seem like it's so kid friendly, but there wasn't much for the kids to do. The clown that came stood at one table the whole time. The dinner buffet was overpriced. The wait for the elevator was ridiculous. When we asked for non-down feather pillows due to allergies, they claimed that all their pillows were polyfill, but they brought up 3 new pillows to appease us. Each one of the pillows they brought up had down feathers. I will say the service was good and the workers were friendly. I just think we could have done better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Gives Special Touches”
Reviews.Author: dmr1960
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I decided for our second marrage to just get married on the beach, in the morning at sunrise. After the short ceremony, we decided to have breakfast at the Clarion. The staff was so amazing. They gave us complimentary drinks with heart-shaped strawberries. We had a small wedding cake that we purchased and they took it back and decorated it with strawberries and whip cream. The waitress took pictures of us. We never asked them to do anything for us, they just took over. We rewarded them by coming back the next day. BTW -when in OC, try their food. They had a great steak and egg breakfast that included a 6 oz. filet and eggs, potatoes and toast for $16.99. We thought it was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected...”
Reviews.Author: RonCam2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Clarion Resort Fontainebleau Hotel in Ocean City, MD. The hotel was a pleasant surprise. Though rated in the bottom of the pack here, our experience was much more enjoyable than others describe. We had a "Oceanfront" room with two doubles. The "Ocenafront" designation, as duly noted in other reviews, is a misnomer. The view is more of a side view which means you can see the bay, the island, and the ocean--but the view is most directly of the property on either side of the hotel. The room was clean and adequate for this type of hotel. There was plenty of space for four of us. The internet service worked well. They had a good variety of television channels available. The pool was larger than many at hotels I have been to recently. Our 11 year old daughter enjoyed swimming there. We grabbed a couple of drinks from the bar and watched her--the drinks were good but not great. My wife and I enjoyed an evening in the bar after coming back from a show at the SunFest. The band was very good. The drinks seemed reasonable priced for this type of location. We did eat the Breakfast Buffett at the hotel also. It was good, but I am not sure it deserved the moniker "World Famous"...the staff was attentive and the food was above average but not excellent. No worries at check-out...the elevators were crowded at busy times, though. Overall, our stay was very nice. I feel like the value was within reason. I did get the reservationist to knock of 20% when I called in--don't take the first rate offer and be nice. It could save you some money!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: wranglerbob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2007 on a golf trip. We had a tremendously good experience. Twelve men, all coming from different directions and checking in at different times, and we were happy. In fact, we're returning next year. Prior to coming here I read the reviews on this site and some of them caused some concern. However it didn't stop me from coming because all our plans were made. My experience was very good. We ended up staying at the hotel each evening rather than go elsewhere to eat. Their restaurant, sports bar and buffet was more than I expected and met all our requirements for quality and taste of food as well as atmosphere for hosting a dozen golfers on a trip. Check in was normal except for the small confusions that one would expect with twelve different guys checking in at different times and looking for their roomie. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the employees were excellent. Parking right in front of the hotel is sparse for the size of the hotel but there is plenty right across the street. This wasn't a problem for us when we were there as the summer season was past and we didn't have any bumper to bumper traffic to navigate if we missed a slot right in front. One of our guys arrived from the south pulling a boat and he had no problems with space for it across the street. The animals were not a problem and weren't a factor in our stay even though we saw many of them. This is because they were on other floors and all the owners seemed to be sensitive to other people and handled the dogs accordingly. I concluded that the concerns that were raised on this site by others were fostered by the summer season when Ocean City is innundated with people. Then I believe it's more of a problem meeting everyone's expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Service”
Reviews.Author: dutchess829
Reviews.Content: Our group of friends went down to the Clarion for a bachelorette party. We have never been here before and booked our hotel online through hotels.com. When we arrived here, we weren't supposed to check in until 4pm, but our room was ready at 2pm when we got there. The front desk was very informative and cordial. Everything about our stay was wonderful. The rooms were clean, the restaurant was wonderful and there was no hassle from anyone! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is right on the beach and is a beautiful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Harvey79
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our dog at this hotel in 8/07. The front desk personnel were helpful and friendly. However, our room (for which we paid over $300) was filthy - there was dirt on the floor and old food in the microwave. There was also a strong stench of mold which emanated from the A/C unit. We called housekeeping twice and eventually the room was cleaned satisfactorily and the A/C unit was serviced by maintenance. The balcony was tiny and , since the rooms were on the side of the building, provided only a distant and limited view of the beach. The outside of the hotel was also filthy, with cigarette butts everywhere. The pet area did not have any poop bags. The problem was that the housekeeping staff largely consisted of college students from foreign countries who did not appear to be adequately trained and/or were not fluent in English! On a more positive note, the room service was good and the seafood buffet was very good and reasonably priced. The hotel definitely needs to be renovated. The room rates are excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: ladyb22
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late and parking lot was full, but there is an overflow lot across the street and they did offer free valet. Due to the late hour check-in was quick. Staff was friendly. The room, bedding, and refrigerator were all clean. The room did have a side ocean view as promised and a small balcony. The "balcony" is just barely enough room to step out. We were on the 12th floor. The size of the balcony may be an issue for some. We ordered breakfast to the room. It arrived fairly quickly, hot, and was good. It was $20 incl. tax and tip for an omlette platter and a french toast platter - pretty good value for room service. The best thing about the hotel is its location, location, location! Beachfront property with its own private life-guarded beach. There are umbrella and chair rentals. There is beverage service right on the beach by wait staff from the hotel's beach bar & grill. A small lemonade was about $1.50, not bad for an ice cold drink delivered to your beach chair. We did not eat at the restaurant or swim in the pool so no comment on the services. We did not encounter any of the problems that others have described. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Laptop Nighmare”
Reviews.Author: DaystarNewYork
Reviews.Content: I went there for the fourth of July holiday. The day started out great but towards the end of the night my friend wanted to put her laptop in the safe because we were going out. We got it in the safe fine. When we came back she need her laptop to do some work she tried to open it but it would not open we tried for about an hour before calling down stairs. when some one came up he could not open the safe either. the next morning some on came up and had to saw off the lock. On a different note the wait for the elevator was a mess, it came like every 15 MINUTES. The view is not ocean but a side view, you have to bend your neck to see the ocean

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kpinche
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my family and small dog. Booked a non-smoking room, but on arrival was given a smoking rm. Front desk was very accomodating and placed us in another room, I almost wished she hadn't. She gave us a handicapped accessible room, that had a terrible stench. I had to purchase several plug-in air fresheners to make the stench less noticable. Someone had left food in the refrigerator, that housekeeping did not remove, plus the refrigerator was dirty. The area designated for pets was small, but much appreciated. The waste removal bags were a plus. The breakfast buffet was just ok, although the omelet prepared "made to order" was very delicious. The big plus was the hotel's location on the beach. Parking was tight, but manageable. I would try another hotel when travelling to Ocean CIty again.

Reviews.Title: “Here a few hours, ready to leave”
Reviews.Author: DrAnnieBananie
Reviews.Content: I've been here now about three hours and already so irritated, my first online task was to write about how awful it's been. We're actually next door, at the Marigold--which we were not told would happen. It has it's own pool, with only limited hours F/S/S, and there is a porch overlooking the ocean. If it had some really comfy chairs, that might make it more bearable. Also, it has assigned parking and not the really scary left turn you have to make when exiting the check in tunnel. We had the same awful dining experience as many others--late, hungry kids, etc. Add also blaring loud music, a ridiculous command that children could not eat after ten, when they had eaten and we were still still still waiting for our FISH. Did they have to catch it? The room is approached off a long hallway, and the light is flashing, more off than on, which freaked all the kids. The list in the kitchen of supplies is far from off, and evidently no one knows how to tighten the knobs on drawers. Although we have a king and a pullout, there were only 3 pillows--all on the bed. Oh, and although it claims to have 3 restaurants, one is seasonal and outdoors. The other is more of a bar--filled with smoke, which we couldn't handle although the idea of the raw bar appealed. Instead we were in the formal dining, being informed the buffet was no longer available, and then they seated us, and our hungry kids right next to it. They didn't take the food away until 9:30, around the same time the kids' meals finally arrived. They came along with our cold appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the mold”
Reviews.Author: BeckyFitz
Reviews.Content: This past week I attended a professional conference at the Clarion Fountainbleu. At first, the conference actually seemed to be a good value, with $54 rooms, and full meals, snacks, etc. However, the blankets were gross, stained and actually dirty on the edges. Sliding glass doors open onto a tiny triangular balcony which allows the hotel to call the room, "ocean view" - since you can step out there and look around the corner of the building to see the ocean. In front of these sliding glass doors, the carpet was actually wet - I suppose there's a faulty seal or something. I awoke in the middle of the first night, wheezing and gasping for breath. To make a long story short, the heater was full of mold. So, I asked for a room change, or for the room to be cleaned of mold. The hotel said that they couldn't move me, but they did clean the room - mopped the floor and vacuumed the carpet, but didn't touch the heater. I specifically asked them to clean the heater, but was told that heaters aren't on their cleaning list. I spent several hours getting medical care today for a toxic mold infection. Turns out the $54 room wasn't such a bargain after all.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Great - Place has some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Rrns828
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Clarion in Aug 2005. Arrived at hotel around 3:00PM, was told no rooms are ready, but was offered a room on the pet floor. We declined. Another front-desk person said that you just cannot check-in until 4:00PM. I was not told about the hard 4:00PM check-in policy when reservation was made. Room was adequate, 2 double beds with a pull-out sofa, decently decorated, everything worked. Had buffet dinner at Horizons restaurant one night and for a buffet, food was pretty good. Shortcomings; Basically no balcony, you could stand but not fit chairs, in fact there are no balcony chairs. Indoor pool only, not many chairs around the pool, and for the size of the hotel, pool is small. No sundeck either. Slow maid service. On one day maid came by at 3:45PM, told her to just forget it for today. On other days room was never attended to before 2:30. Parking was alittle tight on one side of the hotel. Used stairs to and from 11th floor on a few occasions as elevators were slow. Overall not sure if I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: billysmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent two days at the Clarion Fontainebleau at 101st and Coastal Highway. I have to say that the location was great, everything you could possibly need was within either walking distance or just a short drive away. We checked in on Saturday, August 20, arriving at about 3:30 pm. Check in time wasn’t until 4:00 pm, but the line in the lobby to check in was quite long already. It was quite a chaotic scene with all of the cars pulling in and out, but Carla greeted us cheerfully when we arrived. Observing that my husband was having trouble getting around (he’s going through two total hip replacement surgeries) she suggested that he and our dog, Billy, go inside to sit and wait while I got unloaded and parked. She even “held” a handicapped spot for me! What a gem. Check-in at the front desk with Jim was swift, if a bit impersonal. I mentioned that it was our 6th wedding anniversary, but instead of getting congratulations, I got a blank look...oh well! There’s also something going on with the luggage racks. Although I truly appreciated Russell’s help, I could have easily managed our stuff and the rack myself, but I was told that all the ones available for guest use were “taken” and that unless I wanted to wait indefinitely, I would need to utilize a bellman. Same thing when we checked out. Frankly, since there aren’t enough elevators at the hotel, it seems that being forced to use a bell person’s services just adds to the already problematic and over-crowded elevator situation. I overheard at least two families planning to hit the beach earlier the next day because of the crowds trying to get down on the elevators at the same time everyday. Then we got to our room. On the fifth floor (the pet/smoking floor, apparently), it was right next to the elevators, but fortunately, we didn’t notice much noise during our two-day stay. We did have an ocean view, to the left of the balcony. We actually saw dolphins frolicking offshore a couple of times! I figured that the rooms that are maintained for pet accommodations probably wouldn’t be plush, but the condition of our room was very disappointing. The carpet was visibly dirty and recently stained in many places. The footstool for the chair had a large brown smear on the side of it - care to speculate? The screen door on the balcony was broken. There was water/condensation dripping from somewhere higher on the hotel, and you would get wet if you stepped onto the balcony – the first time it happened, I thought it had started raining! Probably the worst thing about the room was the shower. Imagine coming in from spending the day on the beach, all hot and sticky, and you get in the shower and -- all you can get is scalding hot water! Not fun at all, and it actually prevented us from taking a dip the next morning before checking out. It seems that for the extra $30 a night charged to keep our dog with us, the least the hotel could have done was provided a clean, usable room. Also, the pet area is rather far away from the hotel’s front entrance; Billy didn’t make it a couple of times, and had to pee on in the parking lot :) Dogs are not allowed in the dining or pool areas, and not on the beach at all during the season; however, there was a group of people at the pool bar area who had their poodle with them, and no one seemed to mind. In our opinion, Billy had to spend too much time in the room to make it worth bringing him again during regular season (although he really enjoyed the small balcony, but watching him stretch his nose well beyond the railing made us quite nervous.) Now the good things. Overall, the staff at the hotel were just outstanding. They were unfailingly cheerful and helpful. We dined at Horizons for our anniversary dinner, instead of going to the all-you-can-eat buffet being served in a conference room. Horizons was relatively empty, and we were able to enjoy our meal at an oceanfront table. The prime rib was very good (plus you get 20% off all entrees before 7:00 pm, which was a nice surprise) and the service was attentive, if a little overly familiar. After dinner, we hung out at the pool bar, right above Lenny’s beach bar, and enjoyed the live music and an after dinner cocktail. We hit the beach around noon on Sunday, and my limping hubby went down early and was able to get the pleasant young man who rented the beach chairs and umbrellas to set us up. The food and drink service on the beach was great – Jana was very cheerful and provided speedy service too. The pool bar makes a mean pina colada (just ask for a little extra rum!!!) Overall, the hotel staff get a 9 and the hotel itself gets a 5. I’d go back, but probably only off-season. I will post some photos of the room and views a bit later.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Payd2Type
Reviews.Content: My family has gone to the Clarion since way back when it was the Sheraton. Unfortunately it could use some renovation. The pool area really needs to be redone, it is in need of painting, new tables and chairs, and the pool water is always slimey (sand and lotion). I would never swim in it, although the kids dont seem to mind. They are also lacking enough seating at the pool area. On the upside the pool bar makes some slammin' banana daquiris. The rooms have been redone and they are nice. The prices are quite high and I think we will look for somewhere else next year with a nicer pool (kids love swimming), a balcony where you can actually sit outside, at a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “bait and switch for pet owners...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We drove 15 hrs to get to Ocean City, the last several hours in heavy thunderstorms. We were there less than 24 hours. The Clarion Resort Fontainebleau on 101st St OC advertised "pets welcome". After we checked in, exhausted, wet and scraggly and after midnight, we read the paper they give you (only after completing check-in) that details their pet policy. It states that if you leave the pet unattended in the room and it barks or cries, the hotel can go in and remove the pet. That is totally unacceptable. My toy breed dog is my little kid. Also, the "pet rooms" are rooms that obviously no one else will stay in...a view of the ROOF at an "oceanfront resort", with the balcony door welded shut. We would've been better off staying bayside. There were also urine stains all over the wallpaper in the bathroom. For all this luxury, they charged us $119 per night PLUS $30 per night pet fee. The pet is not allowed in the hotel restaurants or pool area, and the town of OC does not allow them on the beach or boardwalk. We spent our time confined to the room, as we were afraid to leave our pet even for a few minutes. I was infuriated. We were supposed to leave Tuesday morning, but packed and drove home about 10 Monday night. My detailed letter of complaint to the hotel itself was ignored, and we were charged for 48 full hours. I advise pet owners to avoid this place entirely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and very clean. Location with highrise hotels/condos was great for us. Beach was filled with families, 10 minute drive to boardwalk, near restaurants. Staff was attentive and friendly and restaurant was suprinsingly good although entertainment was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Not Family Friendly & a Plate of Moldy Fruit found in room!!!”
Reviews.Author: hickenInABiskit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from June 30th & checked out July 3rd(thank god!!). Had I known then what I know now, I never would have stayed there. Family of 5(myself, husband, 15 yr. old, 4 yr. old & 1 yr. old). I personally didn't have any issues with checking in. But the problems started immediately after that!!!! Went to room(8th floor) & almost got smashed with the elevator doors that shut after 3 seconds! Actually lost my 4 yr. old in elevator as she went up to the 16th floor & I am left standing there helpless. The doors shut before the rest of us were able to get in with our luggage. Great start, right?? It gets worse...Get to room & flip light switch & no light working at door.(Have to turn on bathroom light). Send in my 15 yr. old to turn on lamp while I hold open door so she can see & lamp light is also not working. Finally find a lamp with a working light. Call front desk to replace 2 lightbulbs. Next, the room smells so bad(like a dead animal or worse...just smelled so absolutely rotten & it was NOT a smoking room). Once we took our shoes off, figured out the carpet was soaked in spots & socks came up black from walking around. Yuck!! We end up cranking up the air conditioner & opening up our balcony door just to get fresh air circulating in there. Next, hubby makes coffee & when he goes to pour it, it makes a huge mess as he notices the coffee pot is broken pretty badly on the pour spout.(Another call to the front desk & they replace the pot). Ok, that's the first day! 2nd day, get up, take showers to find out hair dryer doesn't work & I have hair down to my butt, so you can only imagine(another call to the front desk..unreal! they must be lovin' me at this point)...man comes up & has to take dryer off the wall & says he needs to take it to the repair shop & replaces with one that works. Today, my husband who is 6'4 notices a plate of food on top of the tall beureau that holds the TV. When he gets it from the back, it is a moldy plate of fruit(probably someone's previous room service)..Nonetheless, we figured out where part of the smell was coming from. Also, most of the cleaning crew don't speak English(not a horrible thing UNTIL you need something from them & they look at you like you are crazy, especially when you are handing them a plate of moldy fruit)!!!!!! Ok, next day, since we had a Family Plan w/ our hotel room, we go to dinner at restaurant which is included. When we get to restaurant, they ask if we want the buffet. We say Sure! They send us to another room where they have the buffet, which we are promptly told it is an additional 6 bucks per person & that it doesn't include drinks, so we decide not to do buffet & go back to the restaurant where not only do we not pay anything extra, we get served, unlike what would happen at the buffet. Very rude front desk girl at restaurant(she seemed altogether unhappy to see us back)..I said we decided not to get the buffet & I swear it was like she was shocked. Anyway, we end up getting seated & this restaurant,especially the tables are not clean, sugar everywhere, dirty glasses, coffee cups & silverware. We told them at front before we got seated that we needed a high chair for the 1 yr. old(duh!!!). When we are seated, our server comes & we had already been there for 2 minutes & still NO highchair. We ask her for a highchair, she says she'll be right back. Comes back & says, all highchairs were taken to buffet room, so I said, "Can someone bring us a highchair from that room??" The girl at the front was also there & says she will see what she can do to get us a highchair. I watched her from the table & she made no attempt whatsoever to get us a highchair. She made no phonecall though at the buffet there were so many workers there, that someone could have brought us a stinkin' highchair. I chalk it up to this woman's rudeness of being someone who apparently doesn't like her job foremost & 2ndly doesn't like families with small children. Server trying to be nice & making excuses for rude woman at front, ends up talking us into a booster seat in which I told her we would need to change tables for a table that had chairs with sides to it so that she wouldn't fall off the side of the chair onto the floor in the booster seat. We changed tables though it seemed like the end of the earth was coming because I asked to do this. It seemed once we were settled, all was good from there. Server very accomodating. Food very good! Then back to the unbearably obnoxiously smelly room. Also, on this particular day, it took housekeeping til 3pm to clean our room. That is just unacceptable. I called to front desk to ask why it seemed like they skipped our room & they told me that they had til' 5pm to clean our room. Indoor pool area nice. Convenient to get to the beach. Ample parking area. We did not visit outdoor bar or indoor bar & did not visit outdoor pool(too busy seeing sites to be worried with all that). Staff at front door of hotel pleasant. People getting room service putting their trays of dirty plates & glasses in the hallway were not getting picked up all day as we came in & out of hotel. Just gross!!!~~~ Checkout was fine. After all this, WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN, especially after making us feel bad for wanting to eat in their restaurant(which was included in Family Plan) & heaven forbid, you ask for a highchair!!! If you expect they are prepared for families, you will be highly mistaken & extremely disappointed. I did not like the way I was treated there at all. The blatant grossness of the smelly room which I'm sure had to be hazardous & obviousness that the cleaning crew are doing the bare minimun after finding that moldy plate of food. We had stayed at Comfort Inn in the past & have never had anything less than clean facilities & wonderful service & that is where we will stay from now on. Feel free to let me know your experience, whether you went with family or not doesn't matter. I'd love to hear from you!!!!!!!!~~~~~

Reviews.Title: “Everything is right in or near the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Clarion this past weekend. I enjoyed the experience very much. Everything you need is right in the hotel or near the hotel. I mean you walk downstairs and you have your own private beach. Plus the staff serves you drinks right on the beach. I thought the serve was great. Also the buffet was very good too. After being out for the night, we headed back to the hotel and went to the bar and that was packed too. It was a lot of fun with people of all different ages. I plan on going back to this hotel sometime this summer. This time I will be bringing my pet because they allow animals there. I had a good experience at the Clarion and would recommend it to everyone. There was also always staff around ready to help out. I liked that a lot. I knew if I had an questions I could get them answered. The only thing I didn't like was the balcony. I thought it should of been a little bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asdaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here way back in March and it is a good time to stay there. One, I got a very cheap rate (70-80 dollars), only a couple of people were on the beach in front of the hotel, so we could let our dogs loose a little. The rooms are very nice, although it wasn't an oceanview room, I could see both the ocean and the bay because I was on like the 7th or 8th floor. In my opinion if you are above the 3rd or 4th floor where the restaurant can't block your view, you can probably see the ocean from any room. My only compliant about the rooms is that the heater was noisy and if you shut it off a draft came in from out side (the rooms have small balconies). Also, the buffet was bad, they cook ommletes or belgium waffles right on the spot, but the bacon was dried out and the sausage didin't taste that good, but other then that the food was great.
